commit_message:
Partial fix for bug 962103 by adding XenAPI flat dhcp docs

Most of the old documentation was very libvirt specific.
I have added a diagrams that is specific to XenAPI,
and have split out general, libvirt and XenAPI docs within
the flat and flat dhcp networking sections.

Change-Id: I2404b0ed6d4f490fb8df915241fdb2bcfa2d653b

subject: blueprint multiprocess-keystone-service
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6, 'name': 'Joe Heck', 'email': 'heckj@mac.com', 'username': 'heckj'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 494, 'name': 'termie', 'email': 'termie@openstack.org', 'username': 'termie'}, {'_account_id': 1188, 'name': 'Rafael Durán Castañeda', 'username': 'rafadurancastaneda'}, {'_account_id': 2035, 'name': 'Maru Newby', 'email': 'marun@redhat.com', 'username': 'maru'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2759, 'name': 'Huang Zhiteng', 'email': 'winston.d@gmail.com', 'username': 'zhiteng-huang'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-05-02 15:19:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(2 inline comments)

question about the LOG level that was added, and this has to have functional unit tests before it can be approved."}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-05-03 18:42:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not submit

I think we need actual performance data before proposing things like this. Python's multiprocess code is extraordinarily buggy and I'd prefer not to use it, in general keystone was designed to be run as multiple instances and load balanced over and I feel that should be the preferred scaling point."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-05-03 18:45:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Andy, we have performance numbers showing this code massively improves throughput of Nova API server (same code was proposed there).

I'm sure Huang can send you the performance data.

Best,

-jay"}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2012-05-05 17:46:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

To Joseph:
Thanks for the comment, I'll fix log level and add default value for workers in next version patch.

To Andy and Jay:
Here's some rough performance data I just collected to prove that multiprocess does brings performance gain (increased throughput, reduced response time).

I had scripts to simulate 32 concurrent users to do 'list_image' of same image to see how many operations can Keystone+Nova+Glance handle per second and how long does it take for OpenStack to process one request.  Nova-API and Glance-API services were both running with 16 workers on standalone 16-core servers.  And Keystone was running with 0(original single process version)/2/4/8 processes on its own 24-core server.  Each test ran 3 times and the data below is the average of 3 rounds.  BTW, I also ran the test without Keystone (using deprecated auth for Nova/Glance) to demonstrate how good can multiprocess Keystone be.   

Keystone Processes	0	2	4	8	No Key
Throughput(op/s)	91.36	143.52	157.61	154.18	156.14
Avg. Resp.Time(sec)	0.35	0.22	0.21	0.21	0.21

As you can see, Keystone was the bottleneck until it was given 4 processes.  2-process Keystone had a 57% perf gain over single process and 4-process perf gain is 73%, while the average response time kept reducing when # of process increase.  When Keystone had >4 processes, the rest (Nova-API/Glance-API) became bottleneck. That explains why 8-process Keystone didn't show any perf gain.  And the 'no-Keystone' data confirms the ceiling of Nova-API/Glance-API throughput in my test setup.

I'd happy to answer any question you have about the performance test.  Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2012-05-09 02:47:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2012-05-09 02:50:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

incorrect duplication of patchset 1.'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2012-05-09 02:59:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Restored

Restore for new patch set.'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2012-05-09 03:00:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-05-09 17:25:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I concur with termie's concerns regarding multiprocessing.  In my experience it's easy to get the happy path working but corner cases (and multiprocessing errata) can make for extremely problematic debugging scenarios.  If this has to go in, ensuring that the implementation is not only fast but maintainable will be key."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-05-09 18:44:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Sorry, guys (termie and mnewby), but have you actually looked at the code here? The multiprocessing module isn't actually being used much at all. It's only used to create the master worker monitor. All actual worker processes are created using standard os.fork() daemonization procedures...

If there really is so many problems with the multiprocessing module (IME, the logging part of it is problematic, but not a whole lot more in modern versions of the library), then it would be easy enough to replace the 2 lines of code in this patch with something else, but please look at this work with more than a cursory look.

Thanks,

-jay"}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2012-05-21 15:21:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Andy, Joe, any comment?  If you need more performance data, I will produce more.  Just let me know, this patch set has been idle for 10 days.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-06-05 00:35:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Maru - ping
@termie - ping

My own preference would be to run the wsgi processes behind Nginx or equiv WSGI-using-reverse-proxy (which is where Ayoung is going for heavy-duty SSL support), but this does look like it'll do the trick to spawn and eat more cores when processing HTTP requests."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-06-19 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-06-19 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2012-06-19 08:44:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Restored

Restore change to continue this effort.'}, {'account_id': 1188, 'date': '2012-06-30 18:46:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

You need rebase master and see in line comments too. In addition you will need review, probably just deleting, this change:

https://github.com/openstack/keystone/commit/012c3d361fc2f6855f3612967aada0fa04aac188

Great job, I hope this make into Keystone, Why don't you try discussing it at keystone meeting in order to try reopening it?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-08 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-08 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

[{'created': '2012-05-02 10:52:24.000000000', 'message': "blueprint multiprocess-keystone-service

Add multiprocess support for keystone serivces (public/admin).
For description of this blueprint, please visit:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/multiprocess-keystone-service

2012-05-02 v1:
    * Modification to wsgi.py/config.py in order to support multiprocess
    (a.k.a. workers) for public/admin services. If multiprocess mode is enabled,
    (i.e. flags 'SERVICE_workers' set to positive numbers), corresponding
    service will run in specified number of process(es). There is also a
    master_worker process spawned for managing all workers (handling signal
    /termination).
    * XXX Doesn't work with KVS backend.
    * XXX Unittest doesn't work as expected.
    TODO: Fix unittest for multiprocess keystone.

Change-Id: I387f9066aaaa539f2a999daaf3098d7ad32bd62d

commit_message:
blueprint multiprocess-keystone-service

Add multiprocess support for keystone serivces (public/admin).
For description of this blueprint, please visit:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/multiprocess-keystone-service

2012-05-09 v2:
    * Add unittest to verify if multiprocess keystone works correctly.
    * XXX Doesn't work with KVS backend.

2012-05-02 v1:
    * Modification to wsgi.py/config.py in order to support multiprocess
    (a.k.a. workers) for public/admin services. If multiprocess mode is enabled,
    (i.e. flags 'SERVICE_workers' set to positive numbers), corresponding
    service will run in specified number of process(es). There is also a
    master_worker process spawned for managing all workers (handling signal
    /termination).

Change-Id: I387f9066aaaa539f2a999daaf3098d7ad32bd62d

commit_message:
Implements updating complete bw usage data

the DB query is not filtering by the mac address.
Hence, only one of them was being updated and
with mismatched bw usage info.

fixes bug 1021961

commit_message:
only mount guest image once when injecting files

Previously we could incur the costly guest mount operation twice,
if injecting files with any of net, ssh keys, password, metadata.
Instead now inject files in the same operation.

Also cleanup the internal injection functions a little
by removing the unused 'execute' parameter.

Change-Id: I228da2229a19d9097507f67b697595616fa601fe

subject: Removing release IP drop down next to Disassociate IP button
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-29 00:14:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-horizon-merge/908/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-horizon-pep8/1063/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-horizon-python26/327/testReport : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-horizon-python27/329/testReport : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/6806/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-06-29 00:41:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

What's the rationale here? Why shouldn't this action be allowed at the row level? It's a rather important action and works correctly in its current form.

Also, if you find things you think are bugs, please open tickets for them on launchpad prior to/in addition to writing patches."}, {'account_id': 1699, 'date': '2012-06-29 00:47:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The rational is two fold.

As it is it looks bad because the column size for the action column is limited.  It's making the display of Disassociate Floating IP look not so good.  I didn't catch that earlier.

It's also pointless.  Because it's not JUST a disassociate IP address it shows up as an unlabeled drop down that's replicating the capabilities of the checkbox addressable action button.  It literally serves no point other than to be a mysterious drop down.

It looks better and functions better without it.

here I MIGHT have been able to drop in a bug.  But it's not really a bug.  Just a change.  

I can file bugs for this stuff though.  Cheers."}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-06-29 00:52:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Okay, I see the visual problem with the disassociate floating ip dropdown menu arrow getting split onto another line. That should definitely be filed as a bug.

However, removing a valid action from the list of actions just so the dropdown doesn't appear is *not* the solution.

We need to fix the CSS so that the arrow for the dropdown doesn't separate from the main button like that."}, {'account_id': 1699, 'date': '2012-06-29 00:55:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think we're better off without that drop down... or having a single ReleaseIPs action button.  A drop down just creates added clicking.  There's already a warning on a release."}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2012-06-29 12:36:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Please add all defects like this as a new bug to be tracked into release management. It is not just a label fix to be excluded from the general rule, but removing existing functionality."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-07 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-07 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Expose owner on v2 image entities

Expand v2 image serialization to accept and return the 'owner'
attribute. All image entities have an owner attribute, while only
admins can provide it in a request. Related to bp api-2.

Change-Id: I8746574528c8be1f17cf570c91ba6bd7ef27b032

subject: This patch stops metadata from being deleted when an instance is deleted.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-07-06 17:54:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I think this is the best approach to making sure notifications and grabbing usage data after an instance has been deleted contain the appropriate metadata at the time of deletion.  As noted with the former patch of just reading deleted metadata...  you would get possibly 'old' deleted data.

I don't think there's a real need to mark things as deleted if they are tied to a deleted instance..  There's still a way to prune the DB by looking at instance['deleted'].."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-06 17:58:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-06 17:45:13.000000000', 'message': "This patch stops metadata from being deleted when an instance is deleted.

This patch makes it so that instance metadata, system metadata, and block
device mappings are no longer set to deleted when an instance is deleted.
It doesn't make sense to delete them just because the instance they describe
has been deleted.

This patch DOES NOT MIGRATE currently deleted metadata or block
device mappings for currently deleted instances, that means that usage
notifications for deleted instances that were deleted before this patch will
show image_meta as empty.

Fixes bug 1021830

Change-Id: I33ee402b859834e09535c7925957bee0a1d91207
"}]
commit_message:
This patch stops metadata from being deleted when an instance is deleted.

This patch makes it so that instance metadata, system metadata, and block
device mappings are no longer set to deleted when an instance is deleted.
It doesn't make sense to delete them just because the instance they describe
has been deleted.

This patch DOES NOT MIGRATE currently deleted metadata or block
device mappings for currently deleted instances, that means that usage
notifications for deleted instances that were deleted before this patch will
show image_meta as empty.

Fixes bug 1021830

Change-Id: I33ee402b859834e09535c7925957bee0a1d91207

commit_message:
Adds additional volume.api class for cinder

 * #6 of blueprint volume-decoupling
 * Attachment now working
 * Detach now working
 * Keystone now working
 * Keystone working for euca
 * euca-create/describe-volume/snapshot works
 * euca-describe after cinderclient create works
 * fix euca volume/snapshot id templates
 * Requires https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7042/
 * Requires https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8001/
 * Requires https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8493/
 * Requires https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8313/
 * Use the above branches for when testing
 * New test_cinder_cloud using fake api
 * Catch up to Glance changes

Change-Id: Ie600b0f0644349a20a9b742c7d51008de6347b54

commit_message:
Move get_context_from_function_and_args() to context.py

Word on the street is that exception.py may soon be deprecated,
and context.py is a better place anyway.

(Also removed an import of utils.py because /it/ imports exception.py.)

Change-Id: I856fc6f4558cc01ddca350ee4cfd4684db47475b

I see `keystone bash-completion` outputs a jumble of potential options, but other than that... how does this enable actual bash completion?'}, {'account_id': 4200, 'date': '2012-07-04 07:36:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

please see tools/keystone.bash_completion

This file must be placed in /etc/bash_completion.d/ (or something similar - depending on the distro).

It will be sourced by bashrc and there is no need to make it executable.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-07-05 18:36:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Produces jumbled output on OS X: http://paste.openstack.org/raw/19286/

Changing the approach to whitespace matching appears to fix my issue on OS X (I actually can't get \s to match *anything*?):

commit_message:
Add update.sh to avoid import conflicts

Attempts to fix #951197

The openstack nose plugin defines the openstack.common namespace
which can result in exceptions when update.py attempts to import
cfg.

Avoid the issue by using an update.sh script which creates a
no-site-packages virtualenv.

Change-Id: I1ec5cf49361303b79306714122b860f6e4912215

commit_message:
Fix up openstack-common build.

Ironically enough, even though the code to manage this is in
openstack-common, openstack-common wasn't using it. This patch fixes doc
generation, as well as setuptools-git integration and versioning.

Change-Id: Ifb74ad539832d8cec4a536a96221eea8fb7527d2

(1 inline comment)

I'm going to change --service_type to --os_service_type for consistency."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-06-27 15:30:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

cool, I really don't like the --os_ prefix but whenever we decide to drop those everywhere will change it for service/endpoint_type as well.."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-06-27 16:11:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-27 16:12:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-swiftclient-merge/36/consoleFull : FAILURE
- gate-python-swiftclient-pep8 : SKIPPED
- gate-python-swiftclient-python26 : SKIPPED
- gate-python-swiftclient-python27 : SKIPPED
"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-06-27 16:21:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

As discussed in https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1018467 we are moving to -os- instead of underscores any chances to change it to hyphens?"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-06-27 17:00:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Chmouel:

Couple of thoughts:

-As far as I can tell *all* openstack projects should be uses dashes. See:

http://wiki.openstack.org/CLIAuth
https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/936400

-If we need to switch swiftclient over to use dashes can we do it in a separate (isolated) commit? I'd rather not piggy back that change onto this one.

As things stand now I think what is here is most consistent.

Also, that last Jenkins failure looks to be invalid. Not sure what happened."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-06-28 08:28:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Okay thanks, let's get this in. we can change that when we have a final policy with the os arguments for folsom."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-07-04 19:55:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: No score

Hey Dan, I have been working on that part of the code to use python-keystoneclient instead of doing ourselves the full 2.0 authentication, this is available here https://github.com/chmouel/python-swiftclient/commit/e005c6e45b4b9c03bab2ff89c80486fe00443db7 and i'm looking to get a bit more fixes before proposing it to python-swiftclient, this will probably invalidatate this review."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-07-04 22:42:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Chmouel: It was my understanding a consolidated client was in the progress anyway... so I'm not sure making a dependency on python-keystoneclient in the short term (for Folsom) is the best idea.

Are we planning on doing the same for novaclient and glanceclient in terms of making them depend on python-keystoneclient?"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-07-04 22:51:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

As mentioned in the README of python-openstackclient here https://github.com/openstack/python-openstackclient the new unified client would be a unifed CLI not a unified library it will actually use the python-$projectclient libraries. 

I am not sure about python-novaclient, IMO it probably should use keystoneclient instead of reinventing the wheel, FWIW this is how it's done for python-glanceclient."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-07-06 15:11:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add support for service_type and endpoint_type.

Updates bin/swift so that is supports --service_type and --endpoint_type
options when using v2.0 style auth. These options are useful if you
want swift to be able to specify alternate service_type (the default is
'object-store') or endpoint type (the default is 'publicURL').

Fixes LP Bug #1016641.

Change-Id: Icc5bd422cedac22736486eba7e56feee825a3a56

commit_message:
heat API : Return auth errors in AWS format

Update EC2 authentication code to return HeatAPIException
subclasses, so the API error response on auth failure is
aligned with AWS responses.
ref #125

Change-Id: Iafa33e7aed4d77f2255b4d879192b9d15a2395aa
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2012-07-05 15:17:56.000000000', 'message': "Exclude openstack-common's gettextutils from pep8.

Updates tox.ini and run_tests.sh to exclude gettextutils.py
from pep8 checks. This hides a pep8 error that recently crept in
with an openstack common merge.

Ideally we could exclude all of openstack-common but it looks
like pep8's --exclude option does a basename on any options you
send it... thus we appear to only be able to exclude the single file.

Fixes LP Bug #1020792.

Change-Id: I2a711046e60b8e524cf2b0810b2f29fb1261fab0
"}]
commit_message:
Exclude openstack-common's gettextutils from pep8.

Updates tox.ini and run_tests.sh to exclude gettextutils.py
from pep8 checks. This hides a pep8 error that recently crept in
with an openstack common merge.

Ideally we could exclude all of openstack-common but it looks
like pep8's --exclude option does a basename on any options you
send it... thus we appear to only be able to exclude the single file.

Fixes LP Bug #1020792.

Change-Id: I2a711046e60b8e524cf2b0810b2f29fb1261fab0

commit_message:
Add basic autoscaling.

This is mainly for ppetit so he can create multiple
resources with one stack.

Use like this:
heat create lots -f ./templates/ppetit.template --parameters="KeyName=${USER}_key;NumInstances=2"

Change-Id: Ie609a1843c855953d65183a8f2d8ed49254a265f
Signed-off-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix run_tests.sh --pep8 jenkins interaction.

run_tests.sh is duplicating work that the jenkins does already, namely, it's
trying to write out pep8.txt - but the jenkins pep8 job writes out pep8.txt
based on the stdout of running tox -epep8.

Fixes bug 1021513.

Change-Id: I433396244b4928de6714dc6145ef84400d2d822d

commit_message:
extend developer documentation

- Add information about the system architecture (modified
  from the wiki to reflect what was implemented).
- Add information about where we want contributions.
- Add information about how to sign up to participate in
  the project and how to be a part of the community.
- Add more detailed instructions for installing the development
  version from git.
- Add a placeholder for documenting the configuration options.
- Add instructions for running the tests after getting
  the source code.
- Add a glossary and index.

commit_message:
Create single initial Cinder DB migration file

 * Implements blueprint initial-db-cleanup
 * Sets initial migration
 * Removes unused tables that were brought in from nova
 * Condenses db migrations into the single initial migration/creation
 * Add explicit mysql set InnoDB in UTF8 loop
 * Folow up patches include:
 *    Remove unused db API calls
 *    Fix/Remove affected tests

Change-Id: If24b00747dbbff7037b7aca39602d5f0b1c6aa50

commit_message:
modify hacking.py to not choke on the def of _()

recent openstack-common brought in it's own def of _() which trips
up our checking that all _ calls contain a message string.

This explicitly excludes the definition of this in function from
that check.

Fixes LP Bug #1020792.

Change-Id: If647d77a5ae5560935bb2e032331c34b896b8614

commit_message:
Get hypervisor uptime.

Adds a call to retrieve the current uptime on a specific hypervisor.
This version of the patch only adds the XenAPI variant; other virt
drivers will raise a NotImplementedError until they implement the
get_host_uptime() method.

Change-Id: Ie259589757a460fcd91a49a8dd8099e4d91524e7

commit_message:
Make possible to store snapshots not in /tmp directory

Add option libvirt_snapshots_directory which specifies path
where snapshots will be stored before libvirt driver uploads
them to the image service.

VM disk snapshot can be quite large,
so keeping them in /tmp is not desirable. Fedora 18 will move /tmp
to tmpfs in RAM, so snapshot functionality will become unusable with
current nova behavior.

Default path for snapshots directory is set to $instances_path/snapshots
in this patch. In case, when shared filesystem is used to hold instances,
option value can be adjusted to improve performance.

Change-Id: I9458a2a26a619a01fa1ddb6955c0220ca747e64d

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-05 12:55:14.000000000', 'message': "Don't catch & ignore exceptions when setting up LXC container filesystems

The 'setup_container' method in nova/disk/api.py may well raise an
exception if something goes wrong when setting up the LXC container's
root filesystem. Currently it just catches & logs any exception.
The caller thus always thinks everything worked & goes onto boot
the container despite there being no root filesystem available
for it.

The fix is to simply remove the bogus exception catching completely

Change-Id: I2691713f11cced1561f347819875f490b8aaafef
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Don't catch & ignore exceptions when setting up LXC container filesystems

The 'setup_container' method in nova/disk/api.py may well raise an
exception if something goes wrong when setting up the LXC container's
root filesystem. Currently it just catches & logs any exception.
The caller thus always thinks everything worked & goes onto boot
the container despite there being no root filesystem available
for it.

The fix is to simply remove the bogus exception catching completely

Change-Id: I2691713f11cced1561f347819875f490b8aaafef
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add checks for retrieving deleted instance metadata for notification events.

This enables metadata for a deleted instance to be reported in usage
notifications. However, deleted metadata for a nondeleted instance will
not be shown.

Fixes bug 1021430.

Change-Id: I7ce5c720c7705be34724679bb4ff99fb8ba37a27

commit_message:
Remove auth-related nova-manage commands

Drop support for management of deprecated auth by deleting
the following nova-manage commands:
* role *
* export *
* project/account * (except scrub and quota)
* shell export
* user *

Additionally, delete relevant documentation and tests.

Related to bp remove-deprecated-auth.

Change-Id: Iad9787f696cb55d4673d68fc60851c7f5bd25805

commit_message:
ignore project files for eclipse/pydev

eclipse is far too commit happy to keep adding these files into the
tree making it a manual process to remove them before submit. This
should make life a little simpler for people using pydev.

Change-Id: Icd0ceea53daa76e6c36933ced174a235e070c394

commit_message:
Make quantum cli consistent with other cli's practice.

Bug 1011759

We use dash in command names, underscore in options or arguments,
adopt noun-verb format command names.

Change-Id: Ibeb2b4a31929dbb7008cec3b04bd77e75d9ace1a

commit_message:
Improve eventlet concurrency when uploading/downloading.

When uploading/downloading multiple images using the
same glance-api worker process some of its eventlet
threads can become starved. Inserting statements to
trigger cooperative yields, ie sleep(0), allows fairer
scheduling of the other eventlet threads.

Fixes LP Bug #1021002.

Change-Id: I5a8f255e9507d18813d07d418e6acefa10d9f6bb

Fix grep on MySQL configuration file

The file is not readable by non-root users (at least on openSUSE), so we
need to use sudo.

The motivation for this change is to avoid hard coding usernames
in my swift object permissions. I'd like to be able to use ID's
for both user and tenant.

Change-Id: I5ab3184af083cf6bf72d11c3d2c2c5a02018cee4

commit_message:
Update swift_auth to support ACL's w/ user_id.

Updates the Swift auth middleware so that it supports individual
ACL permissions with tenant_id:user_id.

The motivation for this change is to avoid hard coding usernames
in my swift object permissions. I'd like to be able to use ID's
for both user and tenant.

Adds test case to cover tenant_id:user_id case.

Fixes LP Bug #1020709.

Change-Id: I5ab3184af083cf6bf72d11c3d2c2c5a02018cee4

[{'created': '2012-07-03 16:30:57.000000000', 'message': 'Drop xenapi session.get_imported_xenapi()

Historically it was used to allow the xenapi fake module to be inserted
in place of the real XenAPI module. However, it was used inconsistently
and is unnecessary now that the session carries that information as well.

Remove it by using the session.XenAPI attribute consistently, and then
removing the stubs and ensuring that the fake module gets inserted
directly into sys.modules.

Change-Id: Id058e19eb7d932abf7b07a1e4324637a8d4b2ea6

Historically it was used to allow the xenapi fake module to be inserted
in place of the real XenAPI module. However, it was used inconsistently
and is unnecessary now that the session carries that information as well.

Remove it by using the session.XenAPI attribute consistently, and then
removing the stubs and ensuring that the fake module gets inserted
directly into sys.modules.

Change-Id: Id058e19eb7d932abf7b07a1e4324637a8d4b2ea6
'}]
commit_message:
Drop xenapi session.get_imported_xenapi()

Historically it was used to allow the xenapi fake module to be inserted
in place of the real XenAPI module. However, it was used inconsistently
and is unnecessary now that the session carries that information as well.

Remove it by using the session.XenAPI attribute consistently, and then
removing the stubs and ensuring that the fake module gets inserted
directly into sys.modules.

Change-Id: Id058e19eb7d932abf7b07a1e4324637a8d4b2ea6

commit_message:
Correct typo in tools/hacking.py l18n -> i18n

i18n stands for internationalization, while l10n stands for
localization. l18n stands for nothing.

Change-Id: Iebfe2dcbc12919875c0ecee8aa9223dc107239d7

[{'created': '2012-07-05 14:11:49.000000000', 'message': 'Finish AUTHORS transition.

The code to generate the authors file from the git changelog has been in the
tree and running for a few weeks now. Somehow the removal of the authors
test and and the MANIFEST.in file were wrong though. This should clean that
up.

Fixes bug 920757.

Change-Id: I66c388c1c81804f8dabc52b5ee25c7f394921e11
'}]
commit_message:
Finish AUTHORS transition.

The code to generate the authors file from the git changelog has been in the
tree and running for a few weeks now. Somehow the removal of the authors
test and and the MANIFEST.in file were wrong though. This should clean that
up.

Fixes bug 920757.

Change-Id: I66c388c1c81804f8dabc52b5ee25c7f394921e11

commit_message:
Allow network_uuids that begin with a prefix

* If the bare network_uuid is not uuid-like, attempt to validate
  with the first 'prefix-' stripped off
* Fix LP1021370

Change-Id: I4914d4ffcb633aef1c5b7f8abfa0b48eaf4f0cc9

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-29 22:40:41.000000000', 'message': "If no password in env or command line, try prompting.

Implements blueprint password-prompt

This logic was recently added to keystone as a short term fix. The long
term fix is to have that same logic here. Basically, if no password is
present in the env or command line and there's a tty available for us
to prompt, then attempt to use getpass.

Change-Id: Ia0eec800b96c8f6ca1c2540e21e0e03c3880c713
"}]
commit_message:
If no password in env or command line, try prompting.

Implements blueprint password-prompt

This logic was recently added to keystone as a short term fix. The long
term fix is to have that same logic here. Basically, if no password is
present in the env or command line and there's a tty available for us
to prompt, then attempt to use getpass.

Change-Id: Ia0eec800b96c8f6ca1c2540e21e0e03c3880c713

Verify the following endpoints:
 - list_stack_resources
 - describe_stack_resources
 - describe_stack_resource

Additionally, check for presence of the correct output keys from the
following endpoints:
 - list_stacks
 - show_stack

Note that some tests are commented out because they are currently failing.
This will be fixed in a future patch.

Change-Id: I1c8c46283c1217789e3d4dea7aeac11c991bcef4
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add more unit tests for the engine API

Verify the following endpoints:
 - list_stack_resources
 - describe_stack_resources
 - describe_stack_resource

Additionally, check for presence of the correct output keys from the
following endpoints:
 - list_stacks
 - show_stack

Note that some tests are commented out because they are currently failing.
This will be fixed in a future patch.

Change-Id: I1c8c46283c1217789e3d4dea7aeac11c991bcef4
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-05 02:24:41.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure system metadata is sent on new image creation.

System metadata is useful for billing and notification purposes.
Sadly, this data was getting lost on new instances created from
snapshots of old instances.

This patch ensures the system metadata of the old instance is
stored in the snapshot for use with creating new instances.

Change-Id: I9fff55c0e9f106afcded1865c7a47bc96ba507a7

commit_message:
Ensure system metadata is sent on new image creation.

System metadata is useful for billing and notification purposes.
Sadly, this data was getting lost on new instances created from
snapshots of old instances.

This patch ensures the system metadata of the old instance is
stored in the snapshot for use with creating new instances.

Additionally, it strips the "image_" prefix from any system
metadata keys (as required).

Change-Id: I9fff55c0e9f106afcded1865c7a47bc96ba507a7

commit_message:
'endpoints' and 'credentials' work with token caching.

The recently introduced token caching busted these two commands
since there was no longer a ServiceCatalog to access. This patch
disables token caching for these commands.

LP1020669

Change-Id: I198acea44fca99b4c907c11198813412df5559bd

commit_message:
Add compatibility for CPU model config with libvirt < 0.9.10

Libvirt versions prior to 0.9.10 do not support the simpler
'mode' attribute for choosing CPU model. So with such libvirt
releases we must explicitly construct the guest CPU model
from the host capabilities info when mode=host-model. We
can not support mode=host-passthrough at all with these
earlier libvirt versions

This change can be reverted in the future, if the value of
the MIN_LIBVIRT_VERSION constant is increased to 0.9.10
or later

Fixes: bug #1003373
Implements: blueprint libvirt-xml-cpu-model
Change-Id: I3e55ffccf38be18454f810efeb5c201aab94ddb0
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Assign service_catalog in NovaKeystoneContext.

Updates NovaKeystoneContext so that the service_catalog variable is
assigned regardless of whether X_SERVICE_CATALOG is set.

Fixes LP Bug #1020779
Change-Id: I3ab15fa53488f2f352718fd230d8ec5e3a38cf56

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-03 14:43:29.000000000', 'message': 'This should fix a problem with overly aggressive token caching.

Previously I was only using the service name and auth url as the
token cache key. This was posing problems with services that have
multiple endpoints and/or are needing different service types
(like volume). Now we take all endpoint selection criteria
into account.

See LP1019054

Change-Id: Ideecca805bb0d0754bcc74e536821f32170b9857
'}]
commit_message:
This should fix a problem with overly aggressive token caching.

Previously I was only using the service name and auth url as the
token cache key. This was posing problems with services that have
multiple endpoints and/or are needing different service types
(like volume). Now we take all endpoint selection criteria
into account.

See LP1019054

Change-Id: Ideecca805bb0d0754bcc74e536821f32170b9857

commit_message:
Remove unused 'get_open_port' method from libvirt utils

As of the following commit:

  commit 71410724cd1516608ee58c37077bf9080da38de2
  Author: Thierry Carrez <thierry@openstack.org>
  Date:   Tue Feb 7 16:37:34 2012 +0100

    Remove ajaxterm from Nova

The 'get_open_port' method in the libvirt utils.py module
is no longer used. Thus is can be deleted

Change-Id: I837d07f82d55c54b4abd82d9bb20498a1f489f84
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2012-07-03 22:02:43.000000000', 'message': "Changed --user to --user_id and --role to --role_id in the keystone client for consistency. Need to update keystone calls here.

This change should be applied after [bug/994744 b7fe11c] in python-keystoneclient.

Fixes bug 994744.

stable/essex note: keystoneclient trunk is used by stable/essex devstack
because there aren't stable branches for client libraries so we need
this change to pass devstack gate, currently failing with:
keystone user-role-add: error: ambiguous option: --user could match
--user-id, --user_id

Change-Id: I13e643f8552d86ed0bf92799271899f777bde9b2
"}]
commit_message:
Changed --user to --user_id and --role to --role_id in the keystone client for consistency. Need to update keystone calls here.

This change should be applied after [bug/994744 b7fe11c] in python-keystoneclient.

Fixes bug 994744.

stable/essex note: keystoneclient trunk is used by stable/essex devstack
because there aren't stable branches for client libraries so we need
this change to pass devstack gate, currently failing with:
keystone user-role-add: error: ambiguous option: --user could match
--user-id, --user_id

Change-Id: I13e643f8552d86ed0bf92799271899f777bde9b2

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-05 12:01:34.000000000', 'message': "Fix use of uninitialized variable in keystone auth API client

The 'service_catalog' variable in NovaKeystoneContext is
set conditionally based on whether the X_SERVICE_CATALOG
HTTP header is present. It is later used unconditionally.
This results in a python exception due to an undeclared
variable when X_SERVICE_CATALOG is not set. Simply
initializing the variable to None avoids the issue.

Change-Id: I46fc677734527360da460d2d01700029cab82c85
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix use of uninitialized variable in keystone auth API client

The 'service_catalog' variable in NovaKeystoneContext is
set conditionally based on whether the X_SERVICE_CATALOG
HTTP header is present. It is later used unconditionally.
This results in a python exception due to an undeclared
variable when X_SERVICE_CATALOG is not set. Simply
initializing the variable to None avoids the issue.

Change-Id: I46fc677734527360da460d2d01700029cab82c85
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add monitoring to the loadbalancer

This makes use of haproxy's unix socket api
to get statistics. This is retrieved by cfn-push-stats
and posted to the watch.

Change-Id: I662293bf5dbc55e3f9106f7ef0ceb0641ddae564
Signed-off-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@redhat.com>

heat-db-drop fails to drop databases when called via
tools/openstack erase, so prompt for password when
not passed as a CLI argument.

Change-Id: I4930b8457e0f3e1488187b35be9737578595c387
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
heat API : Convert API to use HeatAPIException subclasses

Covert API to use HeatAPIException subclasses, instead of
plain webob exceptions, which cannot be correctly serialized
by the wsgi controller, and map engine errors to API exceptions
so the raw engine exception is not propogated to the user.
ref #125
fixes #150

Change-Id: I164c71e12ed29f40ad67188b645ca7ad2fa1fee8
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-07-04 20:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

I agree the cascade solution looks better.
However, on a second thought the real question is probably what the correct behaviour should be when we delete an object. Do we want to delete also all dependent objects (e.g.: subnets for a network, ips for a port), or is it better to raise an error and force the client to first explicitly delete all dependent objects?

Quantum v1 API adopted the latter approach, as far as I can recall.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-07-04 20:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

I agree with the last comment from Dan.
Approving.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-07-04 20:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (3 inline comments)

i have a few questions about consistent use of cascade.  

On Salvatore's question, I'm always a bit hesitant about making programmatic interfaces more cumbersome by adding "safety checks".  To me, that's more of a user-interaction thing (e.g., a GUI could first check the # of port, then prompt the user).  I see both sides though, and don't have a really strong opinion.  this is one of the items we'll have to sort out when finalizing the v2 spec.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-07-04 20:15:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Ok, approving this, as any additional changes wouldn't make sense to do so close to F-2 release."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-07-04 20:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-07-04 20:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-07-04 20:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

V2 has the same approach - for example if a network is deleted then we check if a port is defined on the network. 
If a subnet is deleted we check if a IP is allocated from the subnet.
In the above cases an agent may be using these references - device ID on a network or a reserved IP address on a dhcp server...
I think that this is a reasonable approach.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-04 20:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 4381, 'date': '2012-07-04 20:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-04 20:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-03 14:47:42.000000000', 'message': "Allow admins to share images regardless of owner.

Updates the Glance DB's is_image_sharable function so that
an admin can share an image regardless of the context ownership.

This fixes issues when trying to write Glance functional tests
which use the noauth middleware (UnauthenticatedContextMiddleware).

The motivation behind this change is I'd like to write some
functional tests for image-members that work with noauth.

Change-Id: I6d939876a4c4bf5f191463f5ca434fc524a6ac59

commit_message:
Allow admins to share images regardless of owner.

Updates the Glance DB's is_image_sharable function so that
an admin can share an image regardless of the context ownership.

This fixes issues when trying to write Glance functional tests
which use the noauth middleware (UnauthenticatedContextMiddleware).

The motivation behind this change is I'd like to write some
functional tests for image-members that work with noauth.

Fix bug 1021054

Change-Id: I6d939876a4c4bf5f191463f5ca434fc524a6ac59

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-04 16:25:34.000000000', 'message': 'Make Stacks the owners of their own DB representation

Change the way that Stack objects are initialised, so that they know how to
load and store themselves in the database (they were already updating their
own data, but the actual creation was being done externally). This
consolidates a lot of existing Stack database creation code (in the
manager, nested stacks and unit tests) into one place.

Also, split the template and parameter handling out into separate classes,
and pass these through the constructor for easier testing.

Change-Id: I65bec175191713d0a4a6aa1d3d5442a1b64042f8
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Make Stacks the owners of their own DB representation

Change the way that Stack objects are initialised, so that they know how to
load and store themselves in the database (they were already updating their
own data, but the actual creation was being done externally). This
consolidates a lot of existing Stack database creation code (in the
manager, nested stacks and unit tests) into one place.

Also, split the template and parameter handling out into separate classes,
and pass these through the constructor for easier testing.

Change-Id: I65bec175191713d0a4a6aa1d3d5442a1b64042f8
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

Don't store the metadata server address in the Stack

It is basically a global piece of data, so there is nothing to be gained by
dragging some extra state around with us everywhere.

Change-Id: I50ba7391f258dc7d9b1e186f1618fb140e15b26e
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-04 02:23:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix some hacking violations in the quantum tests.

This patch fixes some import sorting and HACKING violations
in the quantum tests.

Quantum client raises Exception which is discouraged by HACKING.
To avoid some of the HACKING violations we set a constant equal to
Exception and use it for the assertions in the tests.  This avoids
the HACKING violations until we can make quantum client throw a
custom exception class instead.

Change-Id: Ie52d0049dda2d18ad06c5137ca8c316c5531b56a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix some hacking violations in the quantum tests.

This patch fixes some import sorting and HACKING violations
in the quantum tests.

Quantum client raises Exception which is discouraged by HACKING.
To avoid some of the HACKING violations we set a constant equal to
Exception and use it for the assertions in the tests.  This avoids
the HACKING violations until we can make quantum client throw a
custom exception class instead.

Change-Id: Ie52d0049dda2d18ad06c5137ca8c316c5531b56a

"}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-07-04 06:37:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

This is a work in progress - it has been pushed for an early feedback.

This patch is stacked on top of the patch for IP address allocation (bug 1008029).

The most important item I would like to bring your attention is that the API concept of allocation_pools clashes with the IPAllocationRange that has been introduced by the above mentioned patch. Indeed the latter dynamically manages allocation ranges - which are meant to be an internal resource from which pick available IPs to allocate; whereas the allocation pool is supposed to be static and immutable.

I suggest distinguishing the two models, with the AllocationPool matching what the user specified at the API layer and the  IPAllocationRange (which should be rename AvailableIPRange or AvaiableIPPool), representing an internal resource from which allocating IPs.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-04 06:37:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-merge/667/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-pep8/545/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-python26/314/testReport : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-python27/315/testReport : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-07-04 06:37:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-07-04 06:37:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress

Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

This is a work in progress - it has been pushed for an early feedback. This patch is stacked on top of the patch for IP address allocation (bug 1008029).

The most important item I would like to bring your attention is that the API concept of allocation_pools clashes a bit with the IPAllocationRange that has been introduced by the above mentioned patch. Indeed the latter dynamically manages allocation ranges - which are meant to be an internal resource from which pick available IPs to allocate; whereas the allocation pool is supposed to be immutable.
I suggest distinguishing the two models, with the AllocationPool matching what the user specified at the API layer and the IPAllocationRange (which should be renamed to AvailableIPRange or AvaiableIPPool), representing an internal resource from which allocating IPs.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-07-04 06:37:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (36 inline comments)

Thanks all for reviewing this patch even if marked as WIP.
I will push an updated patch tomorrow addressing all your comments.

I will also separate allocation_pools from IPAllocationRange as they are functionally different.
With Gary's permission, I would like to rename IPAllocationRange to AvailableIPAllocationRange for clearly distinguishing them from allocation pools."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-04 06:37:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Add 'allocation_pools' to Quantum v2 API subnets.

This changeset adds a new parameter, 'allocation_pools' to the 'subnet'
resource of the Quantum v2 API.
Allows for creating and validation of subnets with multiple allocation pools.
This commit only deals with POST verb (subnet creation).
PUT verb (subnet update) will be dealt with in a subsequent commit.

This is the first commit for fixing bug #1016308

Change-Id: Ic356dcb5dcfa46af8ecc7e598529881f8bcbbeed

commit_message:
Includes LESS files in bdist packages.

Incidentally cleans up some files that didn't exist in the
MANIFEST.in file.

Fixes bug 1016085 but now needs to be followed by a fix for
bug 1020799 in the future.

Change-Id: I8a53bb17f14afdad61513afa67de7134722c49e9

inside the nova/nova/volumes folder in nova.

commit_message:
Volumes Redux.

Makes all volume-service interactions optional (includes
volumes displays and volumes portion of launch workflow).

Splits Instances & Volumes into separate panels to
facilitate Volumes being optional.

Adds an admin Volumes panel to complement the user
Volumes panel.

Adds the capability to mark Steps in a Workflow as
requiring a given service.

Implements blueprint nova-volume-optional.

Change-Id: I3fb4255617ae52be64e7a300afd691dc36b95586

Here's how I tested it.

1.  Generated keys/certificates in /etc/keystone/ssl...

2.  Kicked off devstack

3.  stopped keystone,  and uncommented /etc/keystone/keystone.conf values for ssl

4.  started keyston and ran

[ayoung@ayoung devstack]$ keystone token-get

I got the error:
__init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'ca_certs'

The keystoneclient-code is set in devstack using:
KEYSTONECLIENT_BRANCH=SSL

In my localrc,  which was generated from the git command above.

It looks like something is not getting the 
ca_certs parameter.  If this proves to be an issue with something other that python-keystone client, I can remove the -1."}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2012-06-26 19:18:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Support 2-way SSL with Keystone server if it is configured to enforce
2-way SSL.  See also https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7706/ for the
corresponding review for the 2-way SSL addition to Keystone.

Change-Id: If0cb46a43d663687396d93604a7139d85a4e7114

commit_message:
documenting models

fixes bug 928441, moved models into keystone.common.models and
roughly documented required and optional fields for various
backends. rebased off master.

Change-Id: I711fe462c09836904a0ee238444c9f04b64a8ade

commit_message:
Provide utilities to automate secure secret key generation

Implements blueprint automatic-secure-key-generation

Reduce the likeliness that the (commented-out) default key is abused
and document possible options instead.

Also use a non-empty SECRET_KEY for development / testing environments.

A later patch would make it a hard error if no SECRET_KEY is defined
(i.e. Django defaults to an empty string which is anything but secure).
Unfortunately, I can't do it now as the devstack integration test would
fail (they don't set a SECRET_KEY either) currently. So, when this
blueprint is accepted, I would submit a fix to devstack and afterwards
add the error message to warn the user about insecure defaults.

Addressed PEP-8 issues

Change-Id: Ifdab8e6b6fb3025fde7a2b92beb046ec9c5cba7f

commit_message:
Add Cinder Volume API to Nova

 * Implements part of blueprint extract-nova-volumes
 * Adds Cinder API to Nova (nova/volume/cinder.py)
 * Add fake volume API to use for unit tests
 * Add specific Cinder ec2/test_cloud version

Signed-off-by: Anthony Young <sleepsonthefloor@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Vishvananda Ishaya <vishvananda@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Id56972e2388a94d184c64bfae9c70a1f2805738b

commit_message:
Modifies ec2/cloud to be able to use Cinder

 * Implements part of blueprint extract-nova-volumes
 * Pass more complete information from ec2api to volume
 * Remove old comment from test_cloud
 * Stops creating mapping on default volume/snap creation, as
   the mapping is automatically created on access

Change-Id: I55f4364940cd606b06ad39256462dc1c436e28f1

2. How will load on the Quantum service affect the nova-network api? 
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-02 09:26:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

Code works for me, and looks good as regards style and organization.

On the pip-requires thing, I recall we often have this kind of discussion - whether packages not strictly necessary need to be there or not. I remember we had it for Cheetah in nova long time ago. I recall we then added a mechanism leveraging __import__ to conditionally import modules. 

If that is still feasible, can't we do the same thing for import python-quantumclient only if quantumv2 is nova's network api?"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-03 12:12:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: (2 inline comments)

blueprint improved-nova-quantum-integration

commit_message:
Implement nova network API for quantum API 2.0

blueprint improved-nova-quantum-integration

This new network API depends on quantum v2.0 client to connect quantum server
via Quantum server API V2.0. This change implements the minimum set of methods
so that we can boot an instance with ip allocated by quantum server.

Change-Id: I34acbbf84dd8601db8143267c8cc41255a0c6d3f

commit_message:
Set iso8601 module as default dependence.

- The iso8601 module is needed by the openstack.common.common.timeutils
  module and not just for testing anymore.
- Fixes bug 1020613.

Change-Id: Iee535b961cc2ac9530e31f4ff4d8c64a1822643f

commit_message:
Add ServiceCatalog entries to enable Cinder usage

 * Part of of blueprint extract-nova-volumes
 * Adds usage of service catalog to ec2
 * Adds entries to auth.py
 * Implements tests for new authorization mods

Change-Id: I2efb375bbb130cde6a1ba119fa862ca45b126a1e

commit_message:
Correct Tree DN

instead of
    cn=example,cn=com,ou=Users
code now generates
    ou=Users,cn=example,cn=com

Getting stricter in testing and adding some regression testing

Fixes Bug 980209

Change-Id: Ib97e6cb00848ea183c7e1f2b2589b25924a08caa

commit_message:
Stop adding the stack user to the sudo or wheel group

This is not needed since we explicitly add a sudoers rule for the stack
user.

Change-Id: I4c63ab25811d55b7eee2677c954133dc3e7ae397

commit_message:
Refactors ec2 mappings for snapshots and volumes

 * Stops creating mapping on default volume/snap creation, as
   the mapping is automatically created on access
 * Adds missing ec2_snapshot_create definition in db/api.py

Change-Id: I6ea8dfcdffbd6f9c76c0dd1ee32e5282d2e8c078

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-29 20:32:33.000000000', 'message': 'Don't call PrettyTable add_row with a tuple.

Updates the print_dict function in utils.py so that it doesn't
try to append a tuple with add_row. According to pydoc add_row
should get passed a list (not a tuple):

  Arguments:

    row - row of data, should be a list with as many elements as
    the table has fields

This fixes a TypeError which can occur with the existing code:

TypeError: can only concatenate list (not "tuple") to list

Fixes LP Bug #1019409.

Change-Id: I16f745afa872106c3bc44c33d88db2a5aacd776c
'}]
commit_message:
Don't call PrettyTable add_row with a tuple.

Updates the print_dict function in utils.py so that it doesn't
try to append a tuple with add_row. According to pydoc add_row
should get passed a list (not a tuple):

  Arguments:

    row - row of data, should be a list with as many elements as
    the table has fields

This fixes a TypeError which can occur with the existing code:

TypeError: can only concatenate list (not "tuple") to list

Fixes LP Bug #1019409.

Change-Id: I16f745afa872106c3bc44c33d88db2a5aacd776c

commit_message:
use import_object_ns for compute_driver loading

Part of bp:virt-driver-cleanup

Convert to using import_object_ns which allows us
to import specific virt drivers as 'libvirt.LibvirtDriver'
instead of 'nova.virt.libvirt.libvirtDriver'.

Update testing to ensure this works with both short
names and long names (which need not be in the nova.virt
namespace).

Change-Id: I5eee3389c7719d5f361532b0eddaa249233283a5

commit_message:
Fix IndexError when adding/updating image members.

This patch updates the v1 registry API to work with the latest
DB API image_member_find function which no longer throws
NoResultFound when it doesn't find any records.

The latest version of the DB API image_member_find function simply
returns an empty query result.

This fixes both member-add and members-replace functionality.

Fixes LP Bug #1020380.

Change-Id: I8818c90e09bd9a17f208d0e20106007db04e77f1

            help=argparse.SUPPRESS)"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-06-27 23:17:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Didn't consider that, thanks for bringing it up, Dean."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-06-28 13:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Okay. If we are going to hide the underscore options in python-glanceclient how would you all feel about doing the same for Nova, Keystone, Swift, etc. as well. As in now... for Folsom, before the new client is finished, etc. We would of course keep the backwards comparability option to use underscores as well (as a hidden option).

Then we can officially update http://wiki.openstack.org/CLIAuth with that being our preference and be done with it.

The point of doing this is consistency. Ideally python-glanceclient would adhere to our project preferences just like anything else.

And to be honest I actually do prefer dashes myself. But that is just my preference. I give consistency the trump card.

Should we take this to the list to build consensus around globally hiding the underscore options?'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-06-28 15:18:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Dan, that is exactly what was intended, it just hasn't been done yet.

FWIW, http://wiki.openstack.org/CLIAuth was specifically written to address the changes in auth options from Diablo to Essex.  For that purpose it is complete.  Further work for Folsom has been done in http://wiki.openstack.org/UnifiedCLI/Authentication in the context of the unified CLI project (openstackclient). Dashes in options are present here."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-06-29 20:48:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-29 21:00:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-27 16:09:30.000000000', 'message': 'Switch CLI to use underscores instead of dashes.

Update the glanceclient CLI to use underscores instead of dashes
for the argument names.

This will hopefully keep the CLI more consistent with the other
OpenStack client projects like Nova, Swift, Keystone in addition to the
old glance client which all seem to prefer underscores to dashes.

Fixes LP Bug #1018467.

Change-Id: I80d7a19f94033554f7f639166911726de4a5159f
'}, {'created': '2012-06-27 19:12:51.000000000', 'message': 'Switch CLI to support underscores and dashes.

Update the glanceclient CLI to support both underscores and dashes.

This will hopefully keep the CLI more consistent with the other
OpenStack client projects like Nova, Swift, Keystone in addition to the
old Glance client which all seem to prefer underscores to dashes.

See http://wiki.openstack.org/CLIAuth as a reference.

As noted on that wiki page underscores have historically been a requirement.
No harm in supporting both dashes and underscores however.

Fixes LP Bug #1018467.

Change-Id: I80d7a19f94033554f7f639166911726de4a5159f
'}, {'created': '2012-06-29 20:48:29.000000000', 'message': 'Switch CLI to support underscores and dashes.

Update the glanceclient CLI to support both underscores and dashes.

Dashes are prefered and show up in help.

This will hopefully keep the CLI more consistent with the other
OpenStack client projects like Nova, Swift, Keystone in addition to the
old Glance client which all seem to prefer underscores to dashes.

Fixes LP Bug #1018467.

Change-Id: I80d7a19f94033554f7f639166911726de4a5159f
'}]
commit_message:
Switch CLI to support underscores and dashes.

Update the glanceclient CLI to support both underscores and dashes.

Dashes are prefered and show up in help.

This will hopefully keep the CLI more consistent with the other
OpenStack client projects like Nova, Swift, Keystone in addition to the
old Glance client which all seem to prefer underscores to dashes.

Fixes LP Bug #1018467.

Change-Id: I80d7a19f94033554f7f639166911726de4a5159f

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1132, 'name': 'Brian Waldon', 'email': 'brian@waldon.cc', 'username': 'bcwaldon'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 209, 'date': '2012-06-28 17:33:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Just curious, how did you come up with 72 rather than, say, 79?'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-06-28 17:35:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I think this is great first step.

The addition of an example commit message would be a great improvement, but it's unnecessary to hold this up for that."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-06-28 17:38:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I would like some clarification on the "details" section of the commit message, things like "it should be possible to figure out what the commit does without referencing external links, such as bug or blueprint links."

(The 72 column figure probably came from a discussion on a previous review, where Vish told the patch submitter that he'd like the commit message wrapped at 72 columns.)'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-06-28 17:42:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Josh:

The major problem is that there isn't a clear place that defines these rules. I wish http://git-scm.org/ would post something, but I understand that they may not want to open that can o' worms. I looked at a few random sites and 72 seemed to be the consensus:

  http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Git/Introduction
  https://github.com/hpcc-systems/HPCC-Platform/wiki/Git-commit-message-guidelines
  http://tbaggery.com/2008/04/19/a-note-about-git-commit-messages.html

Johannes:

You probably noticed that the guide itself is a properly formatted commit message, so if you're asking for an example of content, I definitely agree :)"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-06-28 17:43:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Kevin:

Sure, I can add a block that expands on content a bit. And see my previous comment RE 72 chars. I don't listen to Vish."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-28 17:45:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

I think the example could be clearer. I could fully see someone taking it a bit too literally:

I think Daniel's email did a good job of including examples that reinforced what he said."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-06-28 17:54:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I like it, but I have some inline comments that I think will make things more readable."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2012-06-29 08:30:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Agree with Jim Blair on the use of 3rd-person:
* Fixes bug XXXXXX
* Implements bp foo-bar

I would also recommend usage of "Partially" to indicate that the bug or blueprint is not completely fixed or implemented by this commit:
* Partially fixes bug XXXXXXX
* Partially implements bp foo-bar

That could then be picked up by the tooling to update bugs/bp accordingly.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-07-02 18:54:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

It would be nice to see this combined with what was discussed in this thread:

https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg13742.html'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-02 23:59:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm more interested in getting people to conform to the 50/72 character limits than use specific grammar. Very nice. Couple of Q's."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-03 02:36:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-03 02:37:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2012-07-03 09:24:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Where does the requirement for a 50 character first line come from ?  I think that is unreasonably small from the POV of making an informative subject line. Just a 72 character for all lines of the commit is fine.

WRT to Russell's question about relation to my recent mail thread, I think it is reasonable that the HACKING file guidelines be fairly compact.  My intent is to take the content from that mail thread and turn it into a wiki page. We can then just add a link to the wiki page from this part of the HACKING file for people who want to read the full guidelines."}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-07-03 13:25:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

The 50 character (soft) limit is because some tools use the first line as a subject and display it with other data.  For instance, git log --oneline puts it in a second column after the hash, git format-patch adds it to the subject line of an email after "Subject: [PATCH]" (which of course will then accrue all sorts of Re: FWD: RE: as it's discussed), When gerrit makes a merge commit it creates the subject as 'Merge "<original subject>"', and of course it is used in gerrit's web dashboard.  If you use vim with syntax highlighting, it may already be set up to alert you to the 50 character limit.

Here's a widely circulated blog post on the subject:

http://tbaggery.com/2008/04/19/a-note-about-git-commit-messages.html'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2012-07-03 13:29:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Ok, I see idea now. Though I still think 50 is a little too short, but I'm not going to reject this on that basis."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-03 17:17:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: No score

commit_message:
Do not crash when trying to remove a user role (without a tenant)

Fix bug 999567.

Just use the right method, to stop returning an internal server error
(500). We will return 501 instead, since we stopped supporting user
roles, but at least this is not crashing.

Change-Id: Ia2d6815e712daf146abba5089b79afc8aaddb2d2

subject: decoding json only on 2xx success response bug 1007661
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-04 21:49:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/check-python-keystoneclient-pep8/6/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/check-python-keystoneclient-python26/6/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/check-python-keystoneclient-python27/6/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/check-python-keystoneclient-merge/6/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-06-04 23:00:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-06-13 22:59:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This effectively renders code in exceptions.from_response() useless since keystone *normally* returns JSON-encoded error messages that should be rendered back to the user.

This change means that users will now *always* receive an "Unable to communicate with identity service" message, potentially along with a JSON-encoded response rendered to the user as plain text (i.e. they see the raw JSON), regardless of the actual cause?

I think a better fix for the bug would be to more appropriately handle the ValueError being raised.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-06-14 16:32:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hey Dolph - 

Any error responses from Keystone today will end up throwing an exception regardless in the client - the client isn't using that data at all. Even if we handle the ValueError in the JSON decoding more effectively, it won't change the test outcome, so it seemed more sensible to only decode the JSON after the test against response code."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-06-22 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-06-22 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-06-22 06:07:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Restored

Waiting for dolph to do his digging here...'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-06-26 02:12:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Okay... intentionally triggering an error here (via a bad endpoint). 

Without this patch, the client renders the error as expected:

$ keystone --token=ADMIN --endpoint=http://localhost:35357/v2.0/tokens user-list
Could not find token: users (HTTP 404)

With this patch, suddenly JSON is being rendered back to the user with a irrelevant error message ("unable to communicate" ... which isn't really true at all):

$ keystone --token=ADMIN --endpoint=http://localhost:35357/v2.0/tokens user-list
Unable to communicate with identity service: {"error": {"message": "Could not find token: users", "code": 404, "title": "Not Found"}}. (HTTP 404)'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-06-26 02:15:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Since gerrit is butchering the line breaks above, here's a more complete session for reference: http://paste.openstack.org/show/18788/"}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-06-26 16:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-06-26 16:26:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

resubmitting and marking the bug invalid, since the test is a useful additional. Removing the resequencing per Dolph's display of keystone client logging more appropriate error messages."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-26 16:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/6207/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-06-26 19:08:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Remove the bug from the commit message, or no?'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-06-26 19:44:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I left it for general reference'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-06-29 15:36:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Change CLI options to use dashes

Change documented options to use dashes instead of underscores
in option names.  Continue to support old underscore names for
backward compatibility for a release or two (TBD).

Blueprint: command-options

Change-Id: Ied0d325a9fdd32f80bf8c993887e1975aa6adf16

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-28 23:28:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed bug 1011636 with segmented objects

The X-Object-Manifest header value should be url encoded to allow for
"special" characters to be used. This fix decodes such encoding. A
corresponding fix to python-swiftclient (and any other clients) needs
to be made to url encode the header value when sending.

I also fixed any pep8 1.3.1 violations I found in the test I modified
to verify this.

Change-Id: I67f23dec1dc95ee37354dfdd9897f34758135ee6
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed bug 1011636 with segmented objects

The X-Object-Manifest header value should be url encoded to allow for
"special" characters to be used. This fix decodes such encoding. A
corresponding fix to python-swiftclient (and any other clients) needs
to be made to url encode the header value when sending.

I also fixed any pep8 1.3.1 violations I found in the test I modified
to verify this.

Change-Id: I67f23dec1dc95ee37354dfdd9897f34758135ee6

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-28 14:13:27.000000000', 'message': 'Remove ambiguity in memcache_servers documentation

The documentation could be understood like the following:
memcache_servers from memcache.conf is always used if set, even if
memcache_servers in proxy-server.conf is set.

This is clearly not the case, as proxy-server.conf has a higher priority
if it memcache_servers is set there.

Change-Id: I967c7e80796a0e296c5c65bd097df1669d16203e
'}]
commit_message:
Remove ambiguity in memcache_servers documentation

The documentation could be understood like the following:
memcache_servers from memcache.conf is always used if set, even if
memcache_servers in proxy-server.conf is set.

This is clearly not the case, as proxy-server.conf has a higher priority
if it memcache_servers is set there.

Change-Id: I967c7e80796a0e296c5c65bd097df1669d16203e

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-03 14:33:46.000000000', 'message': "Prevent file injection writing to host filesystem.

Fix bug 1015531, CVE-2012-3360, CVE-2012-3361

This patch prevents the file injection code from writing into the host
filesystem if a user specifies a path for the injected file that
contains '..'. The check is to make sure that the final normalized path
that is about to be written to is within the mounted guest filesystem.

This is a backport of Russell Bryant, Pádraig Brady and Mark
McLoughlin's Folsom patch.

Change-Id: Id8bd6ffb4d878467ba2086d341fce23f2ff5aa0a
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent file injection writing to host filesystem.

Fix bug 1015531, CVE-2012-3360, CVE-2012-3361

This patch prevents the file injection code from writing into the host
filesystem if a user specifies a path for the injected file that
contains '..'. The check is to make sure that the final normalized path
that is about to be written to is within the mounted guest filesystem.

This is a backport of Russell Bryant, Pádraig Brady and Mark
McLoughlin's Folsom patch.

Change-Id: Id8bd6ffb4d878467ba2086d341fce23f2ff5aa0a

commit_message:
Run hacking tests as part of the gate.

Nova has additional pep8 "plugins" that they expect to run as part of the
gate. This patch will run tools/hacking.py instead of pep8 directly. Also,
it fixes the hacking violaions in contrib, plugins and smoketests.

Fixes bug 1010136

Change-Id: I86d8789218c197d5d4a43d1201465d340646a395

commit_message:
Prevent file injection writing to host filesystem.

Fix bug 1015531, CVE-2012-3360, CVE-2012-3361

This patch prevents the file injection code from writing into the host
filesystem if a user specifies a path for the injected file that
contains '..'.  The check is to make sure that the final normalized path
that is about to be written to is within the mounted guest filesystem.

Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Pádraig Brady <pbrady@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I658cd12fd319cee91eb9544cdf53c862c5d2c560

commit_message:
Expose Spiced-Qemu provided backend and interfaces

Expose the spiced-qemu provided backend and interfaces
through libvirt.

To use this you have to enable 'libvirt_enable_vdi'
and specify the path to your kvm-spice binary, through
libvirt_qemu_binary option in your nova.conf.

This commits initial support for spice.

Change-Id: I2b37d22fdc62917ccc63f343c4f1dcb1670e93bb
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Store properties dict as list in simple db driver

Rather than store image properties as a dict, use a list of
dictionaries with name and value keys. Fix bug 1020388.

Change-Id: Ia41e48cb4e869d01c93466103dea8fb1b0ec07a2

commit_message:
Redefine the domain's XML on volume attach/detach

This fixes bug 1004791 by adding new disk definitions to the defined
XML instead of just modifying the running instance.

Change-Id: I6596dae7c54158c32bc7b399c55a1797b2d98242
