messages:
[{'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-06-01 07:26:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

looks good.  We really should make this write out HOST_IP to the config when it autodetects it so that it works on subsequent runs. (On subsequent runs it won't find it because it has been moved to br100)"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-06-04 16:07:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Nice bash-fu :)'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2012-06-04 21:38:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure this will work if you have more than one IP address on the interface.

--> sudo ip a a 13.1.1.1/24 dev eth0

--> ip -f inet addr show eth0
2: eth0: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc mq state UP qlen 1000
    inet 10.1.1.40/24 brd 10.1.1.255 scope global eth0
    inet 13.1.1.1/24 scope global eth0

--> ip -f inet addr show eth0 | awk '/inet/ {split($2,parts,"/"); print parts[1]}'
10.1.1.40
13.1.1.1

You probably only want the first address, and yes, it's probably not a common config, but it's not illegal.'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2012-06-08 13:55:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-08 13:57:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-devstack-merge/391/ : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/4797/ : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2012-06-11 15:28:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-06-14 20:47:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-06-18 14:52:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

`head -1` is not portable and gives an error on Fedora at least. `head -n1` is the portable equivalent. You gould avoid the head in any case with:

    ip -o -f inet addr ls lo | sed 's|.* \(.*\)/.*|\1|;T;q'"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-06-18 14:57:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Responding to Aaron.
The devstack code is putting us between a rock and a hard place. The first stage is to do v1 and v2 support - via your QUANTUM_API flag. Then we need to drop this support as it will be v2 out of the box.
I think that for the first stage we can just append a line to the configuration file "echo target_v2_api = True >> linux_bridge.ini". To be one the safe side we can check if this exists...
If you want I can take the devstack v2 part for linux_bridge.
Sadly as mentioned above we will have to do this for the intermediate stage and for the full v2 (the cleanup)
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

No, this does not need to be in the ini file. The default value is False, meaning that the LB continues to work as it has in the past (over the years I have learnt the hard way about backward compatibility). If the user wishes to use v2 then they should set it to True.
This can be done automatically via devstack (arosen has started some great work on this). Once v2 is up and running we will do the v1 cleanup. The fact that this did not appear in the ini file will be better in the long run - one less file to merge.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:09:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I haven't done a full review of the code yet, but will do so later today. So far the code looks good. But I have one initial comment on the overall approach:

I expected we'd be changing the existing LinuxBridgePlugin class to inherit from QuantumPluginBaseV2 (via QuantumDbPluginV2) instead of QuantumPluginBase, and adding/removing/updating methods as needed. But I see the OVS plugin has also added a new OVSQuantumPluginV2 class instead of updating the existing one. In both cases, I don't see the value in preserving the a V1 plugin implementation.

I'm concerned that trying to maintain support for both V1 and V2 DB schemas adds unnecessary complexity in both the plugin and agent, and may be counter-productive in getting the new V2 code fully tested and shaken out. 

I also would think that the Quantum API code should continue to implement the V1 API in terms of the V2 plugin for as long as compatibility with V1 clients is needed. If this is the case, I see no reason to maintain separate V1 and V2 versions of the same plugin.

So what's the justification for trying to maintain V1 plugins?"}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

See my follow-up to the "Quantum versions" netstack thread for my current thinking on my previous comment.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:09:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(12 inline comments)

Great start!  Minor nits inline."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:09:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Please revise the commit message as per my comments against Patch 3.  

As my comment on error handling around brctl execution, please address the issue in this change or file a bug to have it addressed as part of a separate change."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:09:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

Good. Don't We need unit tests?"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:09:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Seems we need one more rebase after https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9203 gets in."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:09:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

Don't we need to put target_v2_api into plugin's ini file?"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: (2 inline comments)

Looks good'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Should we also add:target_v2_api = False to linuxbridge_conf.ini ?'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Currently in your patch you have it set to True by default. I think it makes more sense to leave it set to True and set it to false in  linuxbridge_conf.ini

At at least I think we need to add target_v2_api =   to the linuxbridge_conf.ini file (maybe in the same configurations section) so that the devstack script can use sed to update this value based on NOVA_USE_QUANTUM_API. 

What do you think?'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I still think you should consider adding: target_v2_api = to the linuxbridge_conf.ini . This way devstack can easily interoperate between versions via sed.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Verified

Build successful

commit_message:
v2 support for the linux bridge plugin

blueprint lb-api-v2-support

Plugin support for the linuxbridge using the v2 API

1. The core_plugin in quantum.conf must be set to:
quantum.plugins.linuxbridge.LinuxBridgePluginV2.LinuxBridgePluginV2
2. By default the agent is v2. A configuration file entry 'target_v2_api'
in the section 'AGENT' can be set as False to support v1.

Change-Id: I2e196859c13b28e535c6ec394ec3f5bc907bf019

[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-22 13:50:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2012-06-22 17:33:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

First, this change would break any script that invokes `swift upload`, as swift would hang indefinitely while waiting for input.

Second, this change adds keyboard I/O within _object_job, which is invoked by up to 10 concurrent threads, so even if it were a good idea to interactively request a different filename (hint: it's not), you can't do it there or you'll just dump a giant mess in the user's terminal.

Third, even if this change worked, it would make multi-file uploads require babysitting to continue; a user can no longer say `swift upload con big-file1 big-file2 ...`, walk away for a couple of hours, and expect it to finish. They'll have to check in every few minutes to see if they need to type "N" on their keyboard so the uploads can continue.'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-06-25 08:04:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with Sam's comment, why don't you add just a name= argument to upload which would upload it to the name specified there?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

++, nice one Monty.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:52:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I believe test failures already result in the log files being saved. It could still be good to have control over the location rather than always going to /tmp/test.XXX."}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-06-25 15:53:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

As commented inline, the logic around only deleting temp files if KEEP_TEMPFILES is unset makes no real difference (these files are left behind regardless).

I'm not sure its a big issue to leave behind the logs and generated config files, but if it's seen as such, the test code should be changed so that files_to_destroy is properly populated.

However I do think the portion of the patch that embeds the test name in the temp dir is useful.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-03 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add ability to collect log files after test runs.

When we're running functional tests in Jenkins, failures get
hard to track down.

commit_message:
Move nova-manage.rst to cinder-manage.rst.

Cinder docs were not building because sphinx was looking for
cinder-manage.rst which did not exist. The file was simply misnamed
and renaming it to cinder-manage.rst allows the docs to build.

Change-Id: I68f4ed81230cc277a96bb34dfa172e5ce7788ac4

commit_message:
Switch to common logging.

I only just moved logging from nova to common, so behavior should remain the same.

Change-Id: I1d7304ca200f9d024bb7244d25be2f9a670318fb

Hi Dan!

Just do:

 pep8 --repeat tempest

from the root dir.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-07-02 15:09:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-02 15:10:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-07-02 15:11:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Heh, thanks. I guess was expecting to run something more formal like the other projects to make sure everything was cool.

Patch set 3 includes two pep8 issues and is now clean in that regard.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-07-02 15:47:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Dan, I think Jay was answering your literal question. Ideally we should be running 'nosetests -v tempest' to make sure everything is working and we would like to see that run as a gating job on all tempest checkins. Unfortunately this takes way too long now and is not quite stable enough. Jay's change to allow tests to run in parallel just went in and we are trying other ways to reduce the run time. So for now it would be good to run all the tests for any changes to the base classes but for submitting a new test it is OK to just make sure that test works."}, {'account_id': 693, 'date': '2012-07-02 17:13:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks Dan!'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-07-02 22:33:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Almost there, Dan. I'd like to combine the two tests into one. Please see final inline comment."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-07-02 23:00:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (3 inline comments)

Looks like the state has changed from STOPPED to SHUTOFF in the last 24 hours, so the test needs to be modified to check for that anyway. Next patch coming soon.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-07-02 23:18:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-02 23:19:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Starting gate jobs.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-07-02 23:23:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Well played. Thanks for your patience, Dan :) And welcome to the Tempest contributor community!

Best,

-jay'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-02 23:23:44.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-02 23:23:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

attach a volume and make sure that it hangs around during a power
cycle. It also tests to make sure that once we detach a volume, it
stays that way during a power cycle.

Also adds servers_client methods for start, stop, attach_volume and
detach_volume. Further adds get_partitions() to remote_client.

Note that right now, this doesn't succeed with libvirt. A patch to nova
is in the works.

commit_message:
Add tests for volume attach and detach

This adds a test_attach_detach_volume case that attempts to create a
server, attach a volume and make sure that it hangs around during a
power cycle. It also tests to make sure that once we detach a volume,
it stays that way during a power cycle.

Also adds servers_client methods for start, stop, attach_volume and
detach_volume. Further adds get_partitions() to remote_client.

Note that right now, this doesn't succeed with libvirt. A patch to nova
is in the works.

Change-Id: Id43175fd9c8e8cf8971e77f212d0dc74a20def4d

commit_message:
Check if interface exists in bridge prior to adding.

This fixes bug 1019730. The fix for bug 1000406 ensures that return
values of shell commands are checked. The command
    utils.execute(['brctl', 'addif', bridge_name, interface],
                   root_helper=self.root_helper)
would cause an exception if there was more than one attachment
on the network. The reason for this was the interface already existed
on the bridge.

Change-Id: I8a1f6cc7be930c04ce302d7f87814b9bd5bed129

up work on bp:virt-driver-cleanup to make driver names more friendly.

Aaron,

Also, what about the agent? Does it niw work with v2 data model only?'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-07-02 20:26:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Looks good. 
Just need some clarifications regarding the V1 status - I am not sure if we are dropping this or continuing the support.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-07-02 20:26:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I haven't done a full review of the code yet, but will do so later today. For now, I have the same concern as about overall approach that I posted on the linuxbridge plugin review:

I expected we'd be changing the existing OVSQuantumPlugin class to inherit from QuantumPluginBaseV2 (via QuantumDbPluginV2) instead of QuantumPluginBase, and adding/removing/updating methods as needed. I don't see the value in preserving a V1 plugin implementation alongside the V2 implementation.

See my comment on patch set 4 of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9101/."}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-07-02 20:26:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

See my follow-up to the "Quantum versions" netstack thread for my current thinking on my previous comment.'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2012-07-02 20:26:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Thanks everyone for your quick review and great comments. This patch does break v1 support in ovs_quantum_agent.py. The main issue here is the change of the column names in the ports table (interface_id/device_id, state/admin_state_up, op_status/status). I agree that we should eventually remove the V1 code but if it is desired to support both versions for now I can work on that. (Gary already started a thread on netstack about this).  

As a side node I posted a patch for devstack (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9161/2/stack.sh) that allows you to configure nova to use V1 or V2 for the time being."}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2012-07-02 20:26:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (7 inline comments)

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-02 20:26:48.000000000', 'message': 'OVS plugin support for v2 Quantum API

blueprint: ovs-api-v2-support

This commit allows the ovs_quantum_plugin to work with the v2 api.

Patch2: left out ovs_mdels_v2, ovs_db_v2 from patch1, clean ups

depends on changes:
quantum server: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8794/
quantum client: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8902/

commit_message:
OVS plugin support for v2 Quantum API

blueprint: ovs-api-v2-support

This commit allows the ovs_quantum_plugin to work with the v2 api.

change-Id: I9e332a799f6bee8a90755f961fbb9711a1ecdaca

'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-06-28 17:04:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

It appears this is adding new modules that aren't being used.

I'd prefer to wait to add new modules until they are actually being used."}, {'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-06-28 17:27:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

So you'd prefer this patch be merged with the following patch?"}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-06-28 17:45:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I see the followup patches now (I hate how Gerrit hides the dependency block by default if it doesn't depend on anything, but other packages depend on this one).

I'd still prefer to keep logical changes together. For instance, the common logging change should include the common logging module and the changes to use the module.

Also, it's generally good form to separate out unrelated changes to separate reviews.

There's been some discussion on this on the mailing list as well.

Hopefully you won't have merge conflicts with the common logging changes touching (almost) every file."}, {'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-06-29 00:45:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

OK... I've now split the first patch into three bits:

1)  Syncing up the files that were already in nova with common.  This necessitates the addition of gettextutils which is now widely used in common.

2)  Adding the common files needed for nova logging.  This change has been merged into the 'use common logging' patch.

3)  Adding the common files needed for nova notifications.  This change has been merged into the 'use common notifications' patch.

Stay tuned!"}, {'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-06-29 00:46:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-29 01:00:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

commit_message:
Updated files from openstack-common.

This update requires the addition of getttextutils because it is now
imported by rpc.

Change-Id: I8d535cb6b19a334ac1fdc212b1202110f5ddb60e

commit_message:
Refactor pagination db functional tests

The pagination-related functional tests are overly complex and aren't
adding a lot of value. This rewrites them in a more straightforward way
by incorporating them into the main test class.

Related to bp refactor-db-layer

Change-Id: Ic08914cfa8135d73a4aae6724a6561bc337b91fb

commit_message:
keystone_manage certificate generation

Bug 1017554

paths now correspond with SSL
unit test for cert generation
Added mode config values
Explict about umask

replace string concat for paths with proper use of os.path.join
Change-Id: I8b3bec82d7b72993aa69653f63ff64c3f675f716

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-06-25 22:53:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Looks like this change will do the same thing:

diff --git a/nova/network/manager.py b/nova/network/manager.py
index fb37499..bedb8e7 100644
--- a/nova/network/manager.py
+++ b/nova/network/manager.py
@@ -983,7 +983,7 @@ class NetworkManager(manager.SchedulerDependentManager):
                                                   context=read_deleted_context)
         # deallocate fixed ips
         for fixed_ip in fixed_ips:
-            self.deallocate_fixed_ip(read_deleted_context, fixed_ip['address'],
+            self.deallocate_fixed_ip(context, fixed_ip['address'],
                                      **kwargs)
 
         # deallocate vifs (mac addresses)

In your patch we are changing the context to read_deleted and then immediately switching it back. Seems better to just pass the original context that does not have read_deleted="yes".'}, {'account_id': 1071, 'date': '2012-06-29 00:13:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1071, 'date': '2012-06-29 00:16:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-29 00:29:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-25 22:31:17.000000000', 'message': "deallocate_fixed_ip attempts to update deleted ip

Fixes bug 1017633. When deleting a vm, the nova
network manager looks to deallocate wrong fixed
ip when context has read_deleted set to 'yes',

commit_message:
deallocate_fixed_ip attempts to update deleted ip

Fixes bug 1017633. When deleting a vm, the nova
network manager looks to deallocate wrong fixed
ip when context has read_deleted set to 'yes',
in case when a network had been deleted and re-
created , it attempts to update already deleted
fixed_ips and therefore looks to teardown from
wrong network_id as well.

Change-Id: I574a20273220ef81498403da80f489732ae81eb1

commit_message:
Refactoring code to kernel Dom0 plugin.

The kernel and ramdisk VDI manipulation code really has nothing to do
with Glance so it doesn't make a lot of sense for it to exist in the
Glance Dom0 plugin.

This patch refactors the code out to its own plugin and then applies a
few misc cleanups.

Change-Id: I363d54ea3c2d51aa6a6c1635b4fb59ebb9ce1fc0

commit_message:
Combine same-time tests with main db test case

Rather than re-run all of the base test methods to test with
image fixtures with identical created_at timestamps, we should
just run methods that matter. This patch removes the subclass
that sets identical timestamps in favor of adding a third fixture
to the main test case.

Related to bp refactor-db-layer

Change-Id: I69d0b21d1ef825333881e021dfa9610f1bbad334

'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2012-06-29 18:26:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

We're actually hitting two bugs in the libvirt here.

1. The python binding should not be unconditionally calling virDomainListDomainIDS(), without first calling virDomainNumOfDomains() to get the accurate count. This flaw is fixed in libvirt 0.9.9, so we can't rely on it yet, since min libvirt in Nova is 0.9.6
 
   commit f0293edc3f2f147e04a837d47288253a9991677a
   Author: Daniel Veillard <veillard@redhat.com>
   Date:   Thu Dec 29 16:20:00 2011 +0800

     remove a static limit on max domains in python bindings


2. The OpenVZ driver should not be returning a fatal error in any case. This is not yet fixed in upstream libvirt. Please file a bug report against libvirt for this issue, and record the BZ number in this commit message for reference purposes.


Once libvirt is fixed we won't need this workaround, so in the short term, rather than littering the code with 'get_num_instances() == 0', every time  conn.listDomainIDs(), please create a helper API

   def list_instance_ids():
       if self._conn.numOfDomains() == 0:
         return []
       return self._conn.listDomainsID()

and replace all calls to listDomainsID(), with this helper.  Also add a TODO item against this method, indicating that it should be deleted once the libvirt OpenVZ bug is fixed - and include the libvirt bug number."}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2012-06-29 19:25:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-29 19:39:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Add check for no domains in libvirt driver.

A check is needed to see if there are any domains before calling
the listDomainsID() method. This check is needed to add support
for OpenVZ which will throw an exception from this method if there
are no domains. The 'virsh' source code does this check, too.

This change circumvents this libvirt bug:
   https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=836647

Change-Id: Ia71d996722a1b531e720e91c1fa68f561ad4d58d

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-02 16:22:42.000000000', 'message': "Sync rpc from openstack-common.

This patch pulls in the latest changes to rpc from openstack-common.
Changes include:

1) Formatting changes.

2) Add a missing gettextutils import to rpc.common and rpc.impl_kombu.

3) Raise an AttributeError from the rpc dispatcher if the version was
fine but the method didn't exist.  This makes the code match previous
behavior pre-version support.

Change-Id: I5b0d4b8eced87cfdfdd4ff7827991bbd9cd0ed43
"}]
commit_message:
Sync rpc from openstack-common.

This patch pulls in the latest changes to rpc from openstack-common.
Changes include:

1) Formatting changes.

2) Add a missing gettextutils import to rpc.common and rpc.impl_kombu.

3) Raise an AttributeError from the rpc dispatcher if the version was
fine but the method didn't exist.  This makes the code match previous
behavior pre-version support.

Change-Id: I5b0d4b8eced87cfdfdd4ff7827991bbd9cd0ed43

openstack-common.  It includes a fix for dealing with

default param to json.dumps().

Change-Id: I61f6734cdf0c85b56a71b350ca07f564454285a5

commit_message:
Sync jsonutils from openstack-common.

This patch syncs the latest changes to the jsonutils module from
openstack-common.  It includes a fix for dealing with
xmlrpclib.DateTime types in to_primitive() and allows customizing the
default param to json.dumps().

Change-Id: I61f6734cdf0c85b56a71b350ca07f564454285a5

commit_message:
Sync iniparser from openstack-common.

This patch pulls in the latest version of the iniparser module from
openstack-common.  It adds support for quoting option values.  For
example:

    foo = "option with a trailing space now works "

Change-Id: Ia2b6e1a7888ceb04e6befe3b221e3deef9f53f0b

commit_message:
Copy global requirements on update.py run.

Copy any entry from the global list of dependencies that exists in the
project's pip- or test-requires files. This way we can keep the versions
the same and ensure that projects only carry a subset of the total set
of packages without adding a bunch of extra depends to everyone.

Fixes bug 995607

Change-Id: I1215df190d8781117ebe511c291cd65b5a4d9248

commit_message:
Add missing gettextutils from openstack-common.

This patch adds gettextutils from openstack-common to nova.  It is used
by rpc, so some parts of rpc are broken without this patch.

Change-Id: I0830319f4e2011b87180abcc24354c935bea8d16

commit_message:
Include all tests in generated tarballs

Make sure all glance/tests is actually shipped in generated
tarballs. Rather than adding yet another specific entry, recursively
include all glance/tests and globally exclude all .pyc.

Change-Id: I7875c58dece452b5356cf7e268f504780ec30bff
Fixes: bug 1018830

subject: don't bash-complete the '-h' option
messages:
[{'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-06-27 10:03:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

what's the problem about completing the -h option it seems that the other bash_completion command does it."}, {'account_id': 4200, 'date': '2012-06-27 10:08:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The problem is, that you always have to enter the 2dn '-' manually.

eg: nova  list -[TAB]

Not completing '-h' allows using the completion more fluently and if you need the help option, there is '--help', which has 2 dashes like all other options."}, {'account_id': 4200, 'date': '2012-06-27 10:10:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Small doc cleanup round.

 - Changes theme to default instead of nature.
 - Explains in terms of Compute API instead of Rackspace
 - Remove outdated reference to nova-manage command
 - Remove unnecessary whitespace

Change-Id: I43d16cd053af0b4be48450fd638f9d17f9e5c4e7

commit_message:
Keystone should use openstack.common.timeutils

Implements blueprint use-common-timeutils

1. Edit openstack-common.conf and import keystone/openstack/common/timeutils.py
2. Replace datetime.utcnow with timeutils.utcnow
3. Replace utils.isotime with timeutils.isotime
4. Remove utils.isotime in common/utils.py and datetime related unittest

Change-Id: I4f5a63a368fde8787a0dc0a817c940de685b9ca2

I played around with this some and got lost of crashes which I know Jay is looking at. I also noticed that while the "create new tenant/user for each test run" is good in a lot of ways, it makes it really hard to diagnose problems because you can't use the usual nova tools (which are per-tenant) to look at what the state of things is, or to destroy leftover stuff. 

It could help if the isolated tenant code wrote a line into a log file with (testclass, user, tenant, password). Then you could use that to diagnose a test and there could be a script like stress/tools/nova_destroy_all.py that read the file and deleted everything.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-06-25 17:08:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-25 17:08:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Looks good to me, Jay. Please see inline question. After this is all working and submitted it would be good to add a utility "destroy" script that imports the test classes and uses their creds to destroy all resources that may be left over during strange test failures or debugging. I would sign up to do that.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-06-25 17:54:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

http://code.google.com/p/python-nose/issues/detail?id=480&thanks=480&ts=1340645326

That said, with this patch, test isolation is much better and I think it's worth sending it through..."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-06-27 22:30:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-27 22:31:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

commit_message:
Refactor Tempest to be parallel-test friendly

* Allows a tenant/user to be created by the base test
  class, allowing isolation of the tests. The base
  compute test case class now controls what users
  and tenants get created for the test case
* Moves identity admin stuff into appropriate directory
* Removes _multiprocess_shared_ to force setUpClass to
  run for every test case.
* Adds setup.cfg for use with openstack.nose_plugin
* run_test.sh refactoring to make running smoketests easier

Change-Id: I3ea4c44a8c194d7ae2833b5443df7678924bcd5d

[{'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-06-29 17:08:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Reversing the order will create a different regression in that it's possible for instance['shutdown_terminate']  to not be set correctly.

Note that _populate_instance_for_bdm() will set instance['shutdown_terminate'] but there's no DB updates for instance after this point.

I think you'll have to move the 'shutdown_terminate' logic out of the _populate_instance_for_bdm() method to somewhere before instance_create()."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-29 17:08:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

commit_message:
Create instance in DB before block device mapping

Fixes lp 1019334

A recently added foreign key constraint on the the block_device_mapping
table causes boot-from-volume to fail, as the bdm is populated before the
instance DB entry is created.

This fix simply transposes the ordering to avoid breaking the constraint.

Change-Id: Ic62ea3ba000a2cdf58d2bd5bb17dde2b8cf340e4

commit_message:
Flesh out the README file with a little more useful information

The current README file contents are amuzing, but could contain
more useful information for downstream users / developers. This
is an attempt to fill out the README file with further content.

Change-Id: I1c364d107d1d6caf110d223560cee3a0a065ee6b
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Pass in stream as positional argument to StreamHandler.

Naming it works in python 2.7 but not in 2.6.

Change-Id: I09cb0e707c428fcfb5d8e825d1acf17b00d84073

commit_message:
Use setuptools git plugin for file inclusion.

Fixes bug 1018833. We're looking at this as a possible pan-project
option instead of manual MANIFEST.in inclusion and then looking for
where the tarballs differ.

Change-Id: I25287d5aca2046c6b613b05d54281533bdd6f79f

commit_message:
Use setuptools-git plugin for MANIFEST.

Instead of a hard-coded MANIFEST.in to list non-code files to be included in
the tarball, use the setuptools-git plugin to ensure that every file that's
in git will wind up in the tarball. The only things needed in MANIFEST.in
now are files that are generated as part of the sdist run.

Change-Id: I76df685d58f7b56977d859e8df92e845f450b3e4

"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-06-27 06:14:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I am not familiar with this, is it the way the other openstack components sets their version using the git tag?

one side effect that may be affect our users is people would not be able to programmatically know the version of the client by import swiftclient.version_info, I am not sure if this is used (since undocumented) but it can be sure nice to have it.'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-06-27 20:58:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

@Chmouel: yep, this is the new standardized way which supports automated builds being pushed to PyPI. The reviews for the rest of the clients are also in the process of being merged currently.

They are all underlain by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9021/ in openstack-common.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-06-27 22:20:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

We can support swiftclient.version_info (or a similar thing) One of the reasons for creating the versioninfo file is so that we can install it in to package_data and get at it via pkg_resources. Hi Brian, a question inline.

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-06-14 20:04:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-06-14 22:59:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-06-15 12:21:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Do not merge

Hmm, it looks like we're missing some fundamental understanding of how boot-from-volume should work - e.g. we're using compute_api.snapshot() here which uploads the image to glance, but the idea with this call is that it should create a new EBS backend AMI (i.e. a new volume)

The original code is clearly trying to create a new bootable snapshot volume and that does seem like it's the right thing

Eoghan and I chatted offline, he's going to do more research

Some references:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/boot-from-volume
http://wiki.openstack.org/BootFromVolume
https://code.launchpad.net/~yamahata/nova/boot-from-volume/+merge/58021"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-06-30 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-06-30 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

[{'created': '2012-06-14 13:33:11.000000000', 'message': "Allow snapshot'ing of running instance via EC2 API

Fixes bug lp 988335

Previously the codepath was completely broken, using the wrong form of image ID,
relying on an unsupported image property, and attempting to download a non-existent
AMI manifest from S3.

It's now rationalized to simply delegate to the ComputeAPI to snapshot the instance.

Change-Id: I89e70873c9c30dc5a3afb0aef608adec84a0b39b

commit_message:
Allow snapshot'ing of running instance via EC2 API

Fixes bug lp 988335

Previously the codepath was completely broken, using the wrong form
of image ID, relying on an unsupported image property, and attempting
to download a non-existent AMI manifest from S3.

It's now rationalized to simply delegate to the ComputeAPI to snapshot
the instance.

Change-Id: I89e70873c9c30dc5a3afb0aef608adec84a0b39b

commit_message:
Allow snapshot'ing of running instance via EC2 API

Fixes bug lp 988335

Previously the codepath was completely broken, using the wrong form
of image ID, relying on an unsupported image property, and attempting
to download a non-existent AMI manifest from S3.

It's now rationalized to simply delegate to the ComputeAPI to snapshot
the instance.

Change-Id: I89e70873c9c30dc5a3afb0aef608adec84a0b39b

commit_message:
Documents vncserver_listen flag when used with live migrations

Live migration breaks if vncserver_listen is set to a specific host
IP address.

Documentation based on this comment from the openstack-operators
mailing list:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2012-June/000965.html

See also comments in bug 1009974.

Cherry picked from https://review.openstack.org/8923

Change-Id: I21b1d3eb5380effda3e2bfcd4f3ea15ea43f096a

Hi Gary,

I think I found a problem on the update_port case. 
Basically, on my environment, the action from gather fixed_ip data from the db simply resets the fixed_ips collection on the port object. 

I don't know if this is actually a problem or just something wrong with my setup."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-06-30 00:12:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: (2 inline comments)

I've tried to look a little bit more into the update issue reported before. In my opinion, the problem does not just belong to my setup. 
Altough I reckon that appropriate transaction mgmt is the best solution, I found out that expiring the port object before building the response solves the problem, as this will trigger a resync with the db.

Diff here: http://paste.openstack.org/show/18855/
The diff includes also some changes to unit tests."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-06-30 00:12:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: (15 inline comments)

(2 inline comments)

Hi Gary,

I have just realized we can specify IPs outside of the subnet's CIDR, as the following test pass:


    def test_update_port_out_of_cidr_ip(self):
        """ Test checks that an IP can be configured even if it's outside of the
            CIDR for the network - and it should fail with a 400 error
        """
        with self.subnet() as subnet:
            with self.port(subnet=subnet) as port:
                ips = port['port']['fixed_ips']
                self.assertEquals(len(ips), 1)
                self.assertEquals(ips[0]['ip_address'], '10.0.0.2')
                self.assertEquals(ips[0]['subnet_id'], subnet['subnet']['id'])
                data = {'port': {'fixed_ips': [{'subnet_id':
                                                subnet['subnet']['id'],
                                                'ip_address': "10.0.1.200"}]}}
                req = self.new_update_request('ports', data,
                                              port['port']['id'])
                res = self.deserialize('json', req.get_response(self.api))
                ips = res['port']['fixed_ips']
                self.assertEquals(len(ips), 1)
                self.assertEquals(ips[0]['ip_address'], '10.0.1.200')
                self.assertEquals(ips[0]['subnet_id'], subnet['subnet']['id'])

I don't think this is by design, but I might be wrong.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-06-30 00:12:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-06-30 00:12:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: (8 inline comments)

Hi Gary,

I apologise but I still have to -1 this patch, as I can confirm out of cidr IPs are still allowed. 

I just run this test on your patch:

    def test_update_port_out_of_cidr_ip(self):
        """Update port with an IP outside of the CIDR scope.

        Will try to update the IP on a port using an IP which does not belong
        to the subnet being updated. We should expect an error (400?)
        """
        with self.subnet() as subnet:
            with self.port(subnet=subnet) as port:
                # CIDR IS 10.0.0.0/24 - Hence this should fail
                data = {'port': {'admin_state_up': False,
                                 'fixed_ips': [{'subnet_id':
                                                subnet['subnet']['id'],
                                                'ip_address':
                                                '10.1.1.200'}]}}
                req = self.new_update_request('ports', data,
                                              port['port']['id'])
                res = req.get_response(self.api)
                self.assertGreaterEqual(res.status_int, 400)

And found out the API returns with 200 and actually assigns 10.1.1.200, which is invalid.
From what I gather from the code, this happens because the following check:

                    if (ip.ip != net.network and
                            ip.ip != net.broadcast and
                            net.netmask & ip.ip == net.ip):
                        found = True
                        subnet_id = subnet['id']
                        break

Is performed only if subnet_id is not specified - while the above test provides both subnet_id and an invalid IP.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-06-30 00:12:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-06-30 00:12:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-06-30 00:12:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: (3 inline comments)

Added a test case for the problem addressed.
Thanks
Gar'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-30 00:12:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Works for me

Please review HACKING's multiline docstring formatting conventions.  Multiline docstrings should have a short description limited to the first line and subsequent lines should follow after a blank line.  The subsequent line should be aligned with the first opening quote, not the first sentence.

Also, please follow PEP257 (http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0257/) for all changed and new docstrings: prescribe the function or method's effect as a command ('Return an IP'), not as a description ('Returns')."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-06-30 00:12:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Implement IP address allocation.

This fixes bug 1008029.

The allocation is done as follows (according to the value of
port['fixed_ips']):
- api_router.ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED - Quantum will generate an IP address.
If a v4 subnet is defined then a v4 address will be generated. If
a v6 subnet is defined then a v6 address will be generated. If both are
defined then both v4 and v6 addresses will be generated.
- user configuration which may contain a list of the following:
   - ip_address - the specific IP address will be generated
   - subnet_id - an IP address from the subnet will be generated

Change-Id: I3bb1b83b8824364b37dbecfa140331c4a1fd2762

commit_message:
Ability to read deleted system metadata records.

Update _instance_system_metadata_get_query to use read_deleted from
the passed in context instead of just hard-coding "no". Also, use
this to ensure system metadata is always collected during delete,
even if the instance was deleted elsewhere.

Fixes bug 1019357

Change-Id: I9285f110801435344fcaa76ba21fb88c23aac2fa

commit_message:
Remove passing superfluous read_deleted argument

model_query() will already set read_deleted to context.read_deleted if
a read_deleted argument is not passed

Change-Id: I3778149e5df4c3a7d62a9cf7186c3f65273359ca

[{'created': '2012-06-28 21:20:17.000000000', 'message': 'OS API should return SHUTOFF, not STOPPED

The recent changes to vm_state/task_state changed the behavior of OS API
to return STOPPED instead of SHUTOFF.

Fixes bug 1019016

The API spec says that SHUTOFF should be returned:

http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-compute/2/content/List_Servers-d1e2078.html

Change-Id: I0a6c786dc8d6b8b42f462cfbec5b70cb67aa2385
'}]
commit_message:
OS API should return SHUTOFF, not STOPPED

The recent changes to vm_state/task_state changed the behavior of OS API
to return STOPPED instead of SHUTOFF.

Fixes bug 1019016

The API spec says that SHUTOFF should be returned:

http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-compute/2/content/List_Servers-d1e2078.html

Change-Id: I0a6c786dc8d6b8b42f462cfbec5b70cb67aa2385

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-15 20:11:18.000000000', 'message': "Switch to SystemExit instead of KeyboardInterrupt.

This patch switches to using SystemExit instead of KeyboardInterrupt.
It looks like the original author needed an exception that wouldn't get
caught by standard except clauses, and incorrectly used KeyboardInterrupt
instead of SystemExit.

KeyboardInterrupt should never be raised on a non-interactive system.

Change-Id: Ie2b7db0601dc815160351fdfe9d319af23de7bb1
"}, {'created': '2012-06-15 22:14:07.000000000', 'message': "Switch to SystemExit instead of KeyboardInterrupt

This patch switches to using SystemExit instead of KeyboardInterrupt.

commit_message:
Switch to SystemExit instead of KeyboardInterrupt

This patch switches to using SystemExit instead of KeyboardInterrupt.
It looks like the original author needed an exception that wouldn't get
caught by standard except clauses, and incorrectly used KeyboardInterrupt
instead of SystemExit.

KeyboardInterrupt should never be raised on a non-interactive system.

Change-Id: Ie2b7db0601dc815160351fdfe9d319af23de7bb1

commit_message:
Dns stops working on precise when network manager is enabled

bug 993666

This fix ensures the dnsmasq instance created by network manager is not killed
Update: ensuring pidof does not return non-zero errorcode if NetworkManager not running

Change-Id: I87c718a24c341ba1c0ca507c4b7d632c84507d01

Build failed

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-horizon-merge/812/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-horizon-pep8/969/consoleFull : SUCCESS

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-horizon-python27/235/testReport : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/6086/consoleFull : FAILURE
"}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2012-06-25 16:51:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

What is the idea behind this change? It was agreed some time ago (here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/909495) that all labels in Dashboard will say "Project" instead of "Tenant". Also, if this fixes an error - it should be added as a bug in the Launchpad project for tracking purposes.'}, {'account_id': 1699, 'date': '2012-06-25 16:53:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Basically it's confusing.  Users need to find out information about their tenancy and if they don't understand that tenant is project in horizon they are left looking through horizon looking for tenant info.

That of course doesn't work so they end up calling up their administrative support.  Which is bad."}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2012-06-25 17:18:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

As I remember from the discussion on the topic, the idea of the renaming was that 'tenant' is used mostly by the Openstack operators, while the end users, who will use Dashboard, are more familiar with 'Project'. In fact the main argument was that "Tenant" doesn't make much sense for most people outside the hosting companies.'}, {'account_id': 1699, 'date': '2012-06-25 17:22:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Which would be well and good except that every auth call to keystone requires the tenant value.  So users are forced to care.'}, {'account_id': 1699, 'date': '2012-06-25 17:33:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1017606

Moving this to a bug report.'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-06-25 18:21:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

As per Devin Carlen on bug 909495:

"Keystone is the only project that uses tenant now. And it will be renaming tenant to project as well during the Folsom timeframe to put this issue to bed once and for all."'}, {'account_id': 2230, 'date': '2012-06-25 18:23:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

I'm sorry you're impatient about the split, or unhappy with the decision, but it has been made. If you want to contribute to improving this, the correct course of action is to work on patching the other parts of openstack."}, {'account_id': 2458, 'date': '2012-06-25 20:05:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

'}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2012-06-29 13:21:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

Matt, this patch doesn't seem to be approved. Would you please abandon it?"}, {'account_id': 1699, 'date': '2012-06-29 18:06:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

This is apparently being addressed in keystone at some future date.  I think that is a mistake but hey... if the PTLs want to make mistakes then by all means.'}]

commit_message:
Add hypervisor information extension.

Adds support for a new nova extension for getting information about
hypervisors (as opposed to compute hosts), including a list of
hypervisors matching a regular expression (database regular
expression, i.e., %'s) and a list of hypervisors with the list of
instances living on those hypervisors.

Change-Id: I7353991ffbf484da175a0912ee46e80f623e230f

Fix images not appearing correctly in externals doc

subject: Document all actions in /etc/*/policy.json
messages:
[{'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-06-08 17:21:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

Most options aren't documented yet, looking for feedback on overall structure of chapter."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-06-08 17:24:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

PDF looks terrible right now.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-06-08 17:25:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I tried to maintain the same grouping as /etc/nova/policy.json, but in some cases it wasn't obvious to me why certain actions appeared in one group instead of another."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-06-08 17:28:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I have no idea if this list is complete, since any action not specified in the policy.json file takes on the default value.

I suspect that the action names are derived from the API calls, but I'm not sure. Ideally, we would generate the list of valid actions from the API docs (?)."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-06-08 21:06:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-06-08 21:09:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I patched with some of the <?sbr?> processing instructions put in, which helps with the PDF output. I think you've got the right first start. One thing I wonder, though, would we be better off mapping to the original "roles" of cloudadmin, itsec, sysadmin, netadmin, developer or were those poorly constructed in the first place? the original description was:

    Cloud Administrator. (cloudadmin) Users of this class enjoy complete system access.
    IT Security. (itsec) This role is limited to IT security personnel. It permits role holders to quarantine instances.
    System Administrator. (sysadmin) The default for project owners, this role affords users the ability to add other users to a project, interact with project images, and launch and terminate instances.
    Network Administrator. (netadmin) Users with this role are permitted to allocate and assign publicly accessible IP addresses as well as create and modify firewall rules.
    Developer. (developer) This is a general purpose role that is assigned to users by default.

We could also make admin-api the "new" defaults, but I think a grouping of example roles is what people are looking for in addition to "what does volume:get_all do exactly?"'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-06-12 20:01:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I like the idea of having some sensible example roles.'}, {'account_id': 1627, 'date': '2012-06-20 08:55:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-20 08:55:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-manuals-merge/506/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-06-20 15:04:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Setting to -1 to ask, Lorin did you want to keep working on this patch to add those example roles or do you want me to?"}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-06-20 15:26:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Work In Progress

Setting to WIP so it doesn't get accidentally merged in."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-06-20 15:27:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Anne: I haven't had time to move forward on this. If you want to work on it, please go ahead, and push up your work as you go. I'll post a comment here if I get a chance to work on this some more."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-06-28 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-06-28 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-06-29 17:31:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Anne:

Do you still want to work on this? Should I revive it?'}]

If you remember I +2'd it. If you'd like to repropose it and make sure its working with and without the namespaces being defined, that would work too. Its just we were trying to track down what was going on, because only some people are seeing it and then you stopped responding."}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-29 17:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Brian, is openstack-nose installed? can you add an except: in there and log or print the exception so we can troubleshoot this?'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-29 17:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So I just tried to replicate on a fresh virtualenv both with and without the openstack namespace being defined:

    $ mkvirtualenv test
    New python executable in test/bin/python

    $ python update.py ../../glance

    Copying openstack.common.policy under the glance module in ../../glance

      Running setup.py install for openstack.nose-plugin
        Skipping installation of /home/jkoelker/.virtualenvs/test/lib/python2.7/site-packages/openstack/__init__.py (namespace package)
    
        Installing /home/jkoelker/.virtualenvs/test/lib/python2.7/site-packages/openstack.nose_plugin-0.7-py2.7-nspkg.pth
      Running setup.py install for nose
    
        Installing nosetests script to /home/jkoelker/.virtualenvs/test/bin
        Installing nosetests-2.7 script to /home/jkoelker/.virtualenvs/test/bin
      Running setup.py install for colorama
    
      Running setup.py install for termcolor
    
    Successfully installed openstack.nose-plugin nose colorama termcolor
    Cleaning up...

    $ python update.py ../../glance
    Copying openstack.common.cfg under the glance module in ../../glance
    Copying openstack.common.importutils under the glance module in ../../glance
    Copying openstack.common.iniparser under the glance module in ../../glance

    Copying openstack.common.setup under the glance module in ../../glance

So its defiantly something in the env, is there any way you can tar up your python environment so I can try to replicate the issues you are having?'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-06-29 17:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-06-29 17:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-29 17:28:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

nm, that wasn't it. I had thought I left the openstack.common namespace being declared from when the nose plugin was part of openstack.common, but that's not the case.

Mark what do you think? I'm tempted to just wrap the import in a try/except that on exception tells the user to run it in a blank venv."}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-29 17:28:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hrm, so something is defining the openstack namespace then, or you'd never get into the except block. I incorporated your last merge prop in, and tested with and without the openstack namespace being defined. Let me know if this still works for you.

Mark: I agree, this is nasty as heck, I'd love to drop it completely. If this doesn't work, I'll see if I can make tox do my bidding in a blank env for everyone so we don't have any namespace issues."}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-29 17:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

I had to pull over quick to put this in. I know where the name space is getting declared at in openstack/common/__in it__.pay

I should be able to fix this more better when I get back to a computer.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-29 17:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-06-29 17:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

if I print the exc in the internal try/finally block, I see this:

  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "update.py", line 73, in <module>
      i, path, description = imp.find_module('openstack/common/iniparser')
  ImportError: No module named openstack/common/iniparser

Why can't we use the fix I posted up a while ago? I've been maintaining a branch locally with the one line diff and that's worked fine.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-06-29 17:28:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Indeed, I did.

As for my environment, I do not appear to have anything nose-related installed through pip: http://paste.openstack.org/show/18486/. I'm not using a virtualenv, either."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-06-29 17:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I still refuse to believe that sorting this out needs to be so complicated, but I don't have a better answer so ... lgtm :)"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-06-29 17:28:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-26 09:37:03.000000000', 'message': 'Do not display None in pretty tables for fields with no value

Fields that are present but unset in a backend (like the email field for
a user created with no email in the KVS backend with the keystone
command line) will appear as "None" when listed, instead of as an empty
field.

Change-Id: I86dc0a204847518e61ba9f6f46d4637d897cfac1
'}]
commit_message:
Do not display None in pretty tables for fields with no value

Fields that are present but unset in a backend (like the email field for
a user created with no email in the KVS backend with the keystone
command line) will appear as "None" when listed, instead of as an empty
field.

Change-Id: I86dc0a204847518e61ba9f6f46d4637d897cfac1

[{'created': '2012-06-20 14:57:11.000000000', 'message': "Fix order of returned tuple elements in pam authenticate

authenticate is supposed to return (user, tenant, metadata) and not
(tenant, user, metadata). It turns out that in the pam case, the content
of tenant and user are equivalent, so it wasn't causing a real bug.

Change-Id: I3d657bddece8961e2234931dcf7cd1d4cd657a39
"}]
commit_message:
Fix order of returned tuple elements in pam authenticate

authenticate is supposed to return (user, tenant, metadata) and not
(tenant, user, metadata). It turns out that in the pam case, the content
of tenant and user are equivalent, so it wasn't causing a real bug.

Change-Id: I3d657bddece8961e2234931dcf7cd1d4cd657a39

commit_message:
Add .mailmap file.

Add this file with relevant entries to avoid duplicate
entries in AUTHORS file.

* .mailmap
  Entries to return unique name/email while using git log command.

Change-Id: If8bb0f6a7ba9dc7d4d3e4a786e05985fcd98e663

In order to filter you just do /images?<filter_key>=<value>.
For Example: /images?name=image-1
or user defined image properties:
/images?foo=bar

You can also filter by a numeric ranges by appending _min and _max to the
filter key.
For Example: /images?size_min=15

Change-Id: Icdbe7c325d08328efb164accf76684a83369c137
'}]
commit_message:
Implement image filtering in v2

This allows filtering /images on image attributes and properties.
In order to filter you just do /images?<filter_key>=<value>.
For Example: /images?name=image-1
or user defined image properties:
/images?foo=bar

You can also filter by a numeric ranges by appending _min and _max to the
filter key.
For Example: /images?size_min=15
For Example: /images?size_max=20&size_min=15

Implements blueprint: api-v2-images-filtering
Change-Id: Icdbe7c325d08328efb164accf76684a83369c137

commit_message:
Dom0 plugin now returns data in proper format.

The virt-layer code was refactored so that a dict was used to pass
around which VDIs are present. This code makes the Dom0 plugin return
that same data structure so we don't have to perform an extra conversion
step.

Change-Id: Ib4f1b0082138d233eb0c3873bbc553395510bc8d

"}, {'created': '2012-06-28 20:16:58.000000000', 'message': "More friendly keyring support when token caching is off.

The token caching would always try to save the token even

environments where there is no keyring agent it would prompt
for a password. Now, if --no_cache is specified it won't try
to save the token.

Also ability to reset timings (--timings) which is handy for
client-driven profiling efforts. Yes, this should be a separate
branch, but it's so tiny it's hardly worth the effort.

I'd also like to take this time to express my admiration for

Change-Id: I97c2c5f6864fe156a3e204927b2831b74fb1c893

commit_message:
More friendly keyring support when token caching is off.

The token caching would always try to save the token even
if --no_cache was specified. The downside of this is
environments where there is no keyring agent it would prompt
for a password. Now, if --no_cache is specified it won't try
to save the token.

Also ability to reset timings (--timings) which is handy for
client-driven profiling efforts. Yes, this should be a separate
branch, but it's so tiny it's hardly worth the effort.

I'd also like to take this time to express my admiration for
Brian Waldon. A stalwart young fellow and a fine coder.

Change-Id: I97c2c5f6864fe156a3e204927b2831b74fb1c893

so there could well be issues remaining. However, I feel that this is

place of NFS

Change-Id: If076bf9103d71e584bdffc026741947f133fa381
'}]
commit_message:
Updates live migration doc to work with nova user

Fixes bug 887358
Update to Live Migration section of the compute manual to address
issues with the NFS configuration that would cause it to fail if
used with Diablo or Essex.

Where possible I have tried to refer readers to the excellent Ubuntu
documentation in preference for copy & pasting sections on generic
systems administration tasks (i.e. configuring NFS).

I have only tested this doc on a similar, but not identical setup,
so there could well be issues remaining. However, I feel that this is
an improvement enough (it has a chance of working!) to check it in.
Your feedback most welcome.

Fixes bug 891082
By linking to the existing GlusterFS document that can be used in
place of NFS

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7602/

Change-Id: If076bf9103d71e584bdffc026741947f133fa381

commit_message:
Made ranged requests on large objects working correctly when size of manifest file is not 0 byte.

Fixed bug 969411

Ranged GET request checked wheter the object is large objects only when response is 416 Requested Range Not Satisfiable.

All ranged GET requests should check the object is large object or not because size of the manifest file can be larger than 0.

Change-Id: Ia3632252d6879a773be881149c10ce0f5ffbcd82

commit_message:
Deal with unknown instance status.

Fix bug 1019020: UNKNOWN_STATE is not a valid status response
according to the OS API specification, UNKNOWN should be returned.

Change-Id: If5f55051fc0f433f11c371f80f403ededf2b4c46

Could it be a better solution (for Folsom) to completely separate nova-api from nova-metadata and allow only the latter to run commands as root ?'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2012-06-08 17:40:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The fix looks valid, but I find myself agreeing with ttx here: the less things capable of running as root, the better off we probably are."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2012-06-11 09:17:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Discussing on the bug, it appears like the policy file should be renamed "rootwrap/api-metadata.py" to make it clear packagers should only deploy it on api-metadata setups.

Then we should probably encourage people to deploy API-specific nova-api setups (with rootwrap/api-metadata.py only on api-metadata setups), but that should not block this bug.'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2012-06-11 14:10:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Yeah, API server is something we want to minimize risk on."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-06-18 19:38:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Given that the bug Mark filed has been marked as invalid, is the functionality implemented useful after all?'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2012-06-29 07:19:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This bug is different: api-metadata servers (unfortunately) need access to a root command. At the very least this needs to be rewritten for the new nova-rootwrap version, or we would find a way to not needing that.'}]

commit_message:
Fixes Bug #1002111 : rootwrap permissions for nova-api

Rootwrap is missing permissions to run iptables
on nova-api server.

- added a dedicated policy file for nova-api rootwrap/api.py
- modified a list of loaded policy modules in rootwrap/wrapper.py

Change-Id: Iaf02dddef3466ee34e0d38787acb2ac036676721

commit_message:
Fix bug 1017775, fix bug 1017766

Some changes to the Dashboard chapter created an incorrect <section> nesting.
Also fixed a typo in the VNC console docs.
Fix bug with the internals images not appearing correctly in the HTML by
referring to png rather than svg.

Change-Id: Ic953ae30219ee216880b49a090f2ac855cbe307d

subject: Removed the min_count and max_count attributes from create server. These are a Rackspace extension. Patch #1: removed commented text, per Jorge. Patch #2: removed extra spaces. commit_message:
Removed the min_count and max_count attributes from create server. These are a Rackspace extension.
Patch #1: removed commented text, per Jorge.
Patch #2: removed extra spaces.
Patch #3: removed change log information for the change that should've never been.
Change-Id: I6e9d7bd2fb68811a94bf1fbef61f15ff0a592441

commit_message:
OVS plugin support for v2 Quantum API

blueprint: ovs-api-v2-support

This commit allows the ovs_quantum_plugin to work with the v2 api.

depends on changes:
quantum server: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8794/
quantum client: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8902/
quantum server: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8794

Change-Id: Ie1cdd13566341e101758bcb6bd45ac12798c2ef0

commit_message:
Add missing utils declaration to RPM spec.

`utils.py` was added by the Dom0 plugin refactoring but the
corresponding declaration in the SPEC file was forgotten.

Change-Id: If12d7389a51928b1f741063e12b3b5a9015d0656
